summary.en: “Prep” usually means preparation or to prepare something (informal).
summary.zh: “prep”常指“准备/准备工作”，或作动词表示“准备（某物）”，多用于非正式语境。

definition.en: preparation; work you do to get ready for something
definition.zh: 准备；为某事做的准备工作

examples.en: We did a lot of prep before the exam.
examples.zh: 考试前我们做了很多准备。

examples.en: Dinner prep takes about 20 minutes.
examples.zh: 晚餐备料/准备大约需要20分钟。

definition.en: to prepare something; to make it ready
definition.zh: 准备；使……就绪

examples.en: I need to prep the slides for tomorrow’s presentation.
examples.zh: 我得为明天的演讲准备幻灯片。

examples.en: She prepped the vegetables before cooking.
examples.zh: 她在做饭前把蔬菜处理好了。

definition.en: (informal) a student who is studying hard for a test or an activity, or someone in a preparatory school context
definition.zh: （非正式）备考的学生；（也可指）预备学校相关的人

examples.en: The preps are meeting after school to review the material.
examples.zh: 备考的同学们放学后要一起复习。

definition.en: (informal) preparatory; intended to help someone get ready
definition.zh: （非正式）预备性的；用于准备的

examples.en: He took a prep course for the TOEFL.
examples.zh: 他上了托福的预备课程。

extraExplanation: “prep”是“prepare / preparation / preparatory”的常见缩写，口语和书面都能见到，尤其在学校（prep course 预备课）、厨房（meal prep 备餐）、医疗（colonoscopy prep 肠镜前准备）等语境。
作为动词时更口语：prep the ingredients（处理食材/备料）、prep for an interview（为面试做准备）。正式写作里更常用 prepare。

summary.en: “Prepack” means to package something in advance or describes goods that are already packaged before you buy them.
summary.zh: “prepack”指“预先包装”，也可形容“已预先包装好的商品”（英式零售语境中也可作名词）。

definition.en: to package something in advance, usually for sale or convenience
definition.zh: （为销售或方便）预先包装

examples.en: The sandwiches are prepacked and ready to grab.
examples.zh: 三明治已经预先包装好，拿了就走很方便。

examples.en: Some fruits are sold prepacked in small boxes.
examples.zh: 有些水果会用小盒子预先包装好出售。

definition.en: already packaged in advance
definition.zh: 预先包装好的

examples.en: I bought a prepack salad from the supermarket.
examples.zh: 我从超市买了一盒预先包装好的沙拉。

examples.en: Prepack meals can save time, but check the ingredients.
examples.zh: 预先包装餐能省时间，但要看看配料表。

definition.en: a package of goods prepared in advance, especially a retail unit (common in UK retail English)
definition.zh: （尤指英式零售用语）预先包装的一包/一份商品

examples.en: The store offers a prepack of cookies at the checkout.
examples.zh: 店里在收银台提供一包预先包装的饼干。

extraExplanation: “prepack”由前缀 pre-（“预先”）+ pack（“打包/包装”）构成。日常英语里更常见的说法是动词短语 “pre-pack” 或形容词 “prepacked / pre-packaged”。
在英式英语的零售场景中，“prepack”也可作名词，指“已按零售单位预先分装好的商品”。在美式英语中，更常用 “prepackaged goods / packaged goods”。

summary.en: Prepackage means to package something in advance, or (more figuratively) to present something as a ready-made, simplified product; prepackaged also works as an adjective meaning “already packaged.”
summary.zh: prepackage 指“预先包装/提前打包”，也可引申为把内容做成“现成、简化的套路”；prepackaged 还可作形容词，表示“已经预先包装好的”。

definition.en: to prepare and package something in advance (before it is needed or sold)
definition.zh: 预先包装；提前打包（在使用或销售之前先完成包装）

examples.en: The meals are prepackaged at the factory and shipped to supermarkets.
examples.zh: 这些餐食在工厂里预先包装好，然后运到超市。

examples.en: We prepackage the kits to save time during busy seasons.
examples.zh: 我们提前把套装打包好，以便在旺季节省时间。

definition.en: to plan or present something in a ready-made, simplified form (often implying less originality)
definition.zh: 把（想法/内容）做成“现成版”来呈现；把…包装成固定套路（常带“缺少新意”的含义）

examples.en: The course can feel prepackaged, with little room for discussion.
examples.zh: 这门课可能显得很“现成化”，几乎没有讨论空间。

examples.en: He didn’t want a prepackaged answer; he wanted an honest conversation.
examples.zh: 他不想要一套预制的答案，他想要真诚的交流。

definition.en: already packaged in advance; ready to sell or use
definition.zh: 预先包装好的；现成的（可直接销售或使用）

examples.en: She bought prepackaged salad for lunch.
examples.zh: 她买了预先包装好的沙拉当午餐。

examples.en: Prepackaged software is faster to install, but less flexible.
examples.zh: 现成软件安装更快，但灵活性较低。

extraExplanation: “prepackage”常见写法也有“pre-package”（带连字符），尤其在形容词形式里更常见“prepackaged / pre-packaged”。两种通常都能接受，但同一篇文章里建议统一风格。
在商业语境里，它偏中性：强调效率与标准化；在表达观点或内容时（如“prepackaged answer/idea”），常带轻微贬义，暗示缺少个性或深度。

summary.en: Prepackaged means packaged or prepared in advance, often standardized rather than customized.
summary.zh: prepackaged 指“预先包装/预先准备好的”，常带有“标准化、非定制”的含义。

definition.en: Already packaged before being sold or used, not packed specially for one customer.
definition.zh: 预先包装好的；不是为某位顾客临时打包的。

examples.en: The supermarket sells prepackaged salads near the entrance.
examples.zh: 超市入口附近出售预先包装好的沙拉。

examples.en: I prefer prepackaged snacks when I travel because they’re easy to carry.
examples.zh: 旅行时我更喜欢预先包装的零食，因为携带方便。

definition.en: Prepared in advance in a fixed, standardized form (often suggesting it is not fresh, original, or customized).
definition.zh: 事先按固定标准准备好的（常暗示不够新鲜、原创或不够个性化）。

examples.en: The speech sounded prepackaged, like it was written by a PR team.
examples.zh: 那段演讲听起来很“预制”，像是公关团队写的。

examples.en: She didn’t want prepackaged solutions; she wanted a plan that fit her team.
examples.zh: 她不想要“现成套装式”的解决方案；她想要适合团队的计划。

extraExplanation: 构词：pre-（在……之前）+ packaged（被包装的）。既可用于食品、药品等“实物提前包装”，也可引申到“观点/台词/方案很套路、很标准化”。
常见搭配：prepackaged meal/food（预制餐/预包装食品）、prepackaged medication（预包装药品）、prepackaged response/answer（套话式回应）。
语气提示：说“prepackaged ideas/answers”时往往带一点批评，暗示缺少真诚或缺少针对性。

summary.en: Prepackage means to package or prepare something in advance in a ready-to-use form.
summary.zh: prepackage 指把商品或材料事先包装/准备成可直接使用的形式。

definition.en: to package goods in advance, usually before sale or distribution (often in a standard-sized container or set)
definition.zh: （通常在销售或分发前）预先包装；事先装盒/装袋（常用标准规格）

examples.en: The snacks are prepackaged in small bags for students.
examples.zh: 这些零食预先包装成小袋，方便学生食用。

examples.en: The store prepackages fresh produce to speed up checkout.
examples.zh: 这家店把新鲜农产品预先包装好，以加快结账速度。

definition.en: to prepare something in advance in a fixed, ready-to-use form (more general use)
definition.zh: （引申）预先把某物准备成固定的、可直接使用的形式

examples.en: They prepackage the training materials so new hires can start immediately.
examples.zh: 他们把培训资料预先整理好，让新员工可以立刻开始。

examples.en: The app prepackages templates for common documents.
examples.zh: 这个应用预置了常见文档的模板。

extraExplanation: “prepackages”通常是动词“prepackage”的第三人称单数形式（He/She prepackages...），也可能是名词复数，但名词用法较少。
在购物场景里，“prepackaged”更常见，表示“预包装的/预先包装好的”（如 prepackaged salad 预包装沙拉）。

summary.en: Prepackaging is packaging goods in advance, especially for sale or shipping.
summary.zh: Prepackaging 指商品在销售或运输前进行预先包装。

definition.en: The process of putting goods into packages (often standardized packages) before they are sold, shipped, or displayed.
definition.zh: 预先包装；在销售、运输或陈列之前把商品装入包装（通常是标准化包装）的过程。

examples.en: Prepackaging helps supermarkets restock shelves quickly.
examples.zh: 预先包装能帮助超市更快补货上架。

examples.en: The company invested in prepackaging to reduce shipping damage.
examples.zh: 公司投资预先包装以减少运输损坏。

definition.en: Prepared and packaged in advance (used as an adjective in some contexts).
definition.zh: 预先包装好的（在某些语境中作形容词使用）。

examples.en: They sell prepackaging meals for busy workers.
examples.zh: 他们销售给忙碌上班族的预先包装餐。

examples.en: We switched to prepackaging components to speed up assembly.
examples.zh: 我们改用预先包装的零件来加快组装。

extraExplanation: “prepackaging”在日常英语里更常见的说法是名词短语“pre-packaging”或“prepackaging”（两种拼写都能见到），形容词通常更常用“prepackaged / pre-packaged”。在商业、物流、食品零售语境里出现频率较高。
与之相关的常见词：“packaging”（包装）、“repackaging”（重新包装）、“bulk”（散装）、“ready-to-sell / shelf-ready packaging”（可直接上架的包装）。

summary.en: Prepacked means packed in advance, ready to sell or use.
summary.zh: prepacked 指“预先包装好的”，可直接出售或使用。

definition.en: Packed in advance (before it is needed, sold, or used), usually in a factory or store.
definition.zh: 预先包装好的（在出售或使用前就已包装好，通常在工厂或商店完成）。

examples.en: You can buy prepacked sandwiches at the station.
examples.zh: 你可以在车站买到预先包装好的三明治。

examples.en: The medicine comes in prepacked doses for safety.
examples.zh: 这种药以预先包装好的剂量出售，以确保安全。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，如：prepaid（预付的）、preheated（预热的）。
在英式英语中更常见拼写为“pre-packed”；美式英语中常见写法是“prepackaged”（预包装的）。
“prepacked”常用于食品、药品、零售商品等语境，强调方便、标准化或卫生，但有时也会引发对“包装浪费”的讨论。

summary.en: Prepacking means packing goods in advance; it can refer to the process or the action of packing ahead of time.
summary.zh: prepacking 指在需要之前先把货物打包/装箱；既可指这一过程，也可指提前打包这一动作。

definition.en: the act or process of packing goods in advance (before shipping, storage, or sale)
definition.zh: 预先包装；预先装箱（在运输、储存或出售前先把货物装好）

examples.en: Prepacking the orders helped the warehouse ship faster during the holiday rush.
examples.zh: 提前把订单打包好，帮助仓库在节日高峰期更快发货。

examples.en: The company uses prepacking to reduce mistakes at the loading dock.
examples.zh: 这家公司用预先装箱来减少装货区的错误。

definition.en: to pack something in advance
definition.zh: 预先包装；提前打包

examples.en: We prepacked the samples so the sales team could leave early.
examples.zh: 我们提前把样品打包好，让销售团队可以早点出发。

examples.en: The factory prepacked each set with labels and instructions.
examples.zh: 工厂把每套产品提前装好，并放入标签和说明书。

extraExplanation: 在零售和服装行业里，prepack 也常指“预配套装/预包装组”（比如同一款衣服按 S/M/L 不同尺码组合成一个预先配好的包），方便门店直接上架与补货。

summary.en: “Prepacks” means products packaged in advance, or the act of packaging them ahead of time.
summary.zh: “Prepacks”指预先包装好的商品，或指把商品提前包装的行为。

definition.en: to package or assemble products in advance, before they are sold or used
definition.zh: （在出售或使用前）预先包装；预先配好（商品/材料）

examples.en: The factory prepacks the snacks in small bags for convenience.
examples.zh: 工厂把零食预先装进小袋里，方便携带。

examples.en: We prepacked the kits with batteries, instructions, and tools.
examples.zh: 我们把套件预先配好电池、说明书和工具。

definition.en: prepackaged items; goods that are already packed and ready to sell or distribute
definition.zh: 预包装商品；已事先包装好、可直接销售或分发的货品

examples.en: The pharmacy received a shipment of prepacks for the promotion.
examples.zh: 药房收到了一批用于促销的预包装商品。

examples.en: They replaced bulk items with prepacks to speed up checkout.
examples.zh: 他们用预包装商品替代散装商品，以加快结账速度。

extraExplanation: “prepack(s)”在零售、食品与医药行业里很常见，强调“提前打包好、到店即可上架/销售”。在医药领域有时也指厂商预先分装好的小包装，便于发放或促销。

summary.en: Prepaging means preparing and packaging items in advance, or (in computing) preloading memory pages ahead of time.
summary.zh: Prepaging 指提前准备并预先包装；在计算机领域也可指预先加载内存页面以提速。

definition.en: the act or process of preparing and packaging products in advance (often into individual portions or ready-to-sell units)
definition.zh: （尤指将商品）提前准备并预先包装的过程（常见于分装、预包装成可直接售卖/使用的单位）

examples.en: The kitchen saves time during lunch rush by prepaging salads in the morning.
examples.zh: 厨房会在早上把沙拉预先分装打包，这样午餐高峰就能省时间。

examples.en: Some stores reduce waste by prepaging only a limited number of items each day.
examples.zh: 有些商店每天只预先包装少量商品，以减少浪费。

definition.en: (computing) loading data or memory “pages” ahead of time so programs run faster
definition.zh: （计算机）预先把数据或内存“页面”加载好，以提升程序运行速度

examples.en: The operating system uses prepaging to reduce delays when an app starts.
examples.zh: 操作系统会用预分页来减少应用启动时的卡顿。

examples.en: Turning off prepaging can sometimes save memory on older machines.
examples.zh: 在较旧的电脑上，关闭预分页有时能节省内存。

extraExplanation: “prepaging”常见于专业语境，写法也常见为“pre-paging”（加连字符更清晰）。在零售/餐饮里更贴近日常；在计算机领域则指虚拟内存中的“paging（分页）”。
如果你本来想写的是“prepackaging / pre-packaging（预包装）”，那是更常用、更标准的表达。

summary.en: Prepaid means paid in advance, and it can also be used as a verb meaning to pay ahead of time.
summary.zh: prepaid 表示“预付的/预先付费的”，也可作动词表示“预先支付”。

definition.en: Paid for in advance, before you use it (often for phones, cards, or services).
definition.zh: 预付的；预先付费的（常用于电话、卡或服务）。

examples.en: I use a prepaid phone plan because it helps me control my spending.
examples.zh: 我用预付费手机套餐，因为它能帮我控制开支。

examples.en: You can buy a prepaid SIM card at the airport.
examples.zh: 你可以在机场买一张预付费SIM卡。

examples.en: The hotel requires a prepaid reservation during the holiday season.
examples.zh: 节假日期间酒店要求预付订房。

definition.en: To pay for something in advance.
definition.zh: 预先支付；预付。

examples.en: We prepaid the rent for three months.
examples.zh: 我们预付了三个月的房租。

examples.en: If you prepay, you may get a small discount.
examples.zh: 如果你预付，可能会有一点折扣。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，“paid”来自 pay（支付）的过去式/过去分词，所以 prepaid 字面意思就是“提前付过钱的”。常见搭配：prepaid card（预付卡）、prepaid plan（预付费套餐）、prepaid expenses（预付费用，偏会计/商务用语）。
在美国语境里，prepaid phone plan 通常指“无合约、先充值再使用”的手机服务；与 postpaid（后付费：先用后付，月底账单结算）相对。

summary.en: Prepainful means occurring before something becomes painful (rare usage).
summary.zh: prepainful 指“在变得疼痛之前发生/出现的”（用法较少见）。

definition.en: (Rare) Happening before something becomes painful; causing discomfort that comes just before pain.
definition.zh: （少见）发生在变得疼痛之前的；在疼痛出现前引起不适的。

examples.en: Some people feel a prepainful tightness in their chest before the sharp pain starts.
examples.zh: 有些人在剧烈疼痛开始前，会先感到胸口有一种“痛前”的紧绷感。

examples.en: The dentist asked if I noticed any prepainful sensitivity to cold drinks.
examples.zh: 牙医问我喝冷饮时有没有出现“疼痛之前的”敏感不适。

extraExplanation: “prepainful”并不是常见词，更自然的写法通常是带连字符的 **pre-painful**，或直接用更常用的表达：**before it becomes painful**（在变得疼痛之前）、**early discomfort**（早期不适）、**mild soreness**（轻微酸痛）。
在医学或身体感受的描述中，人们更常说 **prodromal**（前驱的；症状出现前的），例如：**prodromal symptoms**（前驱症状）。不过这个词更偏正式、医学语境。

summary.en: “Pre-Palaeolithic” means “before the Paleolithic period.”
summary.zh: “pre-Palaeolithic”表示“旧石器时代之前的”。

definition.en: Before the Paleolithic period (the earliest stage of the Stone Age); earlier than Paleolithic in time or development.
definition.zh: 旧石器时代之前的；早于旧石器时代的（在时间或发展阶段上更早）。

examples.en: The museum has a small exhibit on pre-Paleolithic toolmaking theories.
examples.zh: 博物馆有一个关于旧石器时代之前工具制作理论的小展区。

examples.en: Some scholars once used “pre-Paleolithic” to describe very early, debated stone finds.
examples.zh: 一些学者曾用“旧石器时代之前的”来描述一些非常早、但仍有争议的石器发现。

extraExplanation: 在考古学写作中，“pre-Paleolithic”并不是最常用的标准分期词，因为“旧石器时代（Paleolithic）”本身通常被视为最早的石器时代阶段。若要表达“比旧石器时代更早”，学术上更常见的说法包括：early hominin period（早期人族时期）、before the Lower Paleolithic（早于旧石器时代早期）、pre-Stone Age（石器时代之前，较少用）等。
拼写说明：英式常见写法为“Palaeolithic”，美式更常见为“Paleolithic”。作为前缀时常写作“pre-Paleolithic / pre-Palaeolithic”，也可连写为“prepalaeolithic”，但后者较少见，正式写作建议加连字符以便阅读。

summary.en: Prepalatal describes a sound made just in front of the hard palate.
summary.zh: prepalatal 指在硬腭前方一点位置发出的语音（发音部位）。

definition.en: (phonetics) Articulated just in front of the hard palate (the “roof” of the mouth), often referring to a consonant made between the alveolar ridge and the palate.
definition.zh: （语音学）在硬腭（口腔上颚的前部）之前一点的位置发音的；常指发音部位介于齿龈嵴与硬腭之间的辅音。

examples.en: In some descriptions, /ʃ/ is treated as a prepalatal fricative.
examples.zh: 在一些描述中，/ʃ/ 会被视为“前腭位”的擦音。

examples.en: The textbook contrasts alveolar, prepalatal, and palatal places of articulation.
examples.zh: 这本教材对比了齿龈音、前腭音和腭音的发音部位。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前/前面”，因此 prepalatal 字面意思就是“在腭（palate）之前的”。它多见于语音学/语言学资料中，用来更精细地区分发音部位。
不同资料对术语的划分不完全一致：有时 prepalatal 会与“alveolo-palatal（齿龈腭音）”或“postalveolar（后齿龈）”的范围部分重叠。阅读时可留意作者的发音部位定义与配图。

summary.en: Prepalatine means “in front of the hard palate,” used mainly in anatomy/dentistry and sometimes in phonetics.
summary.zh: prepalatine 指“位于硬腭前方/硬腭前部的”，多用于解剖学、牙科语境，语音学中偶见。

definition.en: Located in front of the hard palate (the bony roof of the mouth).
definition.zh: 位于硬腭（口腔顶部的骨性部分）前方的；硬腭前部的。

examples.en: The surgeon noted swelling in the prepalatine region.
examples.zh: 外科医生注意到硬腭前部区域有肿胀。

examples.en: A small blood vessel runs along the prepalatine area near the upper front teeth.
examples.zh: 在靠近上前牙的硬腭前部区域，有一条小血管走行。

definition.en: (Phonetics) Made with the tongue positioned just in front of the hard palate; similar to “pre-palatal.”
definition.zh: （语音学）舌位在硬腭前方发音的；近似“硬腭前音/前腭音”。

examples.en: Some descriptions group certain consonants as palatal or prepalatine depending on tongue position.
examples.zh: 一些描述会根据舌位把某些辅音归为硬腭音或硬腭前音。

examples.en: The text contrasts prepalatine and palatal articulations.
examples.zh: 这篇教材对比了硬腭前音与硬腭音的发音部位。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前/前方”，而“palatine”与“palate（腭）”有关，所以 prepalatine 字面意思就是“腭前的”。在医学/牙科语境中更常见，通常指上颌前部、切牙附近的硬腭区域。
语音学里它较少作为日常术语出现，常与 palatal（硬腭音）对比，用来更细致地描述舌头接近硬腭但略偏前的位置。不同教材可能用词不完全一致。

summary.en: Pre-Paleolithic means “before the Paleolithic period,” usually used in archaeology.
summary.zh: prepaleolithic 指“旧石器时代之前的”，多用于考古学语境。

definition.en: (Often in archaeology) relating to the time before the Paleolithic period; earlier than the earliest widely recognized Stone Age cultures.
definition.zh: （常用于考古学）指旧石器时代之前的；早于最早被广泛认可的石器时代文化。

examples.en: The site may contain pre-Paleolithic layers beneath the known Paleolithic tools.
examples.zh: 该遗址在已知的旧石器工具层之下，可能还包含旧石器之前的地层。

examples.en: Claims of pre-Paleolithic artifacts require very strong evidence and careful dating.
examples.zh: 关于“旧石器之前”器物的主张需要非常有力的证据和严谨的年代测定。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”。这个词多见于学术写作，常写作 pre-Paleolithic（带连字符、P 大写），因为 Paleolithic 是专有的历史时期名称。
由于“旧石器时代”本身已是人类史上最早且证据较充分的阶段之一，因此 pre-Paleolithic 往往带有“争议性/证据要求更高”的语感，常出现在讨论非常早期人类活动或疑似更早石器的语境中。

summary.en: Prepanic describes the period or feeling just before panic begins.
summary.zh: prepanic 指“恐慌发生之前”的阶段或带有恐慌前兆的感觉。

definition.en: (of a feeling, state, or moment) happening just before panic starts; showing early signs of panic.
definition.zh: （情绪、状态或时刻）发生在恐慌爆发之前的；带有恐慌前兆的。

examples.en: She felt a prepanic tightness in her chest when the train stopped in the tunnel.
examples.zh: 当列车在隧道里停下时，她感到胸口有种恐慌前的紧绷感。

examples.en: In the prepanic minutes, the staff focused on calming people and giving clear instructions.
examples.zh: 在恐慌爆发前的几分钟里，工作人员专注于安抚人群并给出清晰指令。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“在……之前”。因此 prepanic 字面意思就是“panic（恐慌）之前的”。
这个词在正式词典中不算非常常见，更常见的写法是连字符形式 pre-panic；在新闻报道、心理描述或叙事写作里偶尔会用来强调“恐慌还没真正发生，但已经快要发生了”的阶段。

summary.en: “Preparable” describes something that can be prepared or made ready, often ahead of time.
summary.zh: “preparable”用于形容某事物能够被准备好，常含“可提前准备”的意思。

definition.en: Able to be made ready in advance; capable of being prepared.
definition.zh: 可预先准备的；能够准备好的。

examples.en: The ingredients are all preparable ahead of time, so dinner will be easy.
examples.zh: 这些食材都可以提前准备好，所以晚餐会很轻松。

examples.en: Some tasks are preparable, but others require real-time decisions.
examples.zh: 有些任务可以提前准备，但有些需要当场做决定。

extraExplanation: “preparable”由前缀 pre-（在……之前）+ prepare（准备）+ -able（可……的）构成，含义直观：表示“可以提前准备/可以被准备好”。
在日常英语中，人们更常用的表达是 “can be prepared in advance / can be prepared beforehand” 或直接说 “easy to prepare”。“preparable”本身偏正式、偏书面一些。

summary.en: A French-derived term meaning someone who prepares specimens/materials—often in museums/labs, pharmacies, or sports training.
summary.zh: 源自法语，指“负责准备/处理”的工作人员，常见于博物馆/实验室标本处理、药房配制或体育体能训练等语境。

definition.en: (Borrowed from French) A person whose job is to prepare things—especially scientific or museum specimens—for study, preservation, or display (e.g., fossils, insects, animal skins).
definition.zh: （源自法语）负责“准备/处理”材料的人，尤指为研究、保存或展览而处理科学或博物馆标本的人（如化石、昆虫、动物皮张等）。

examples.en: The museum hired a preparateur to clean and mount the fossil bones.
examples.zh: 博物馆雇了一位 preparateur 来清理并固定化石骨骼。

examples.en: As a lab preparateur, she prepared samples for microscopy.
examples.zh: 作为实验室的 preparateur，她为显微镜观察准备样本。

definition.en: (In French-speaking contexts) A technical assistant who prepares materials or products, such as a pharmacy technician who prepares medicines under a pharmacist’s supervision.
definition.zh: （在法语语境中）负责配制/准备材料或产品的技术助理，例如在药师监督下配制药品的药房技术人员。

examples.en: In France, a preparateur en pharmacie may prepare prescriptions for the pharmacist to check.
examples.zh: 在法国，preparateur en pharmacie 可能先配制处方药，再由药师复核。

definition.en: (Sports, especially in European/French usage) A trainer or conditioning coach who prepares athletes physically for competition.
definition.zh: （体育领域，尤见于欧洲/法语用法）体能教练/训练师，负责让运动员在身体上为比赛做好准备。

examples.en: The club’s preparateur focused on strength and recovery sessions.
examples.zh: 俱乐部的 preparateur 主要负责力量训练和恢复课程。

extraExplanation: “preparateur / préparateur”本质上是法语名词，来自“préparer（准备）”。英语里更常见的对应词是 **preparator**（如 museum preparator）或更具体的职位名称（lab technician、specimen preparator 等）。
在英语文章中看到 **preparateur** 往往是作者保留法语头衔（常见于法国机构、体育新闻或药房相关语境），并非最常用的英语拼写。

summary.en: Preparation means getting ready in advance—either the process of planning or the specific work done beforehand; it can also mean a prepared product (a preparation).
summary.zh: preparation 指“提前做准备”的过程或具体筹备工作；也可指“制剂/配制品”等按特定方法制成的产品。

definition.en: the act or process of getting ready for something; planning and organizing beforehand
definition.zh: 准备；预备（为某事提前做计划、安排与整理的过程）

examples.en: Good preparation makes the exam feel less stressful.
examples.zh: 充分的准备会让考试没那么紧张。

examples.en: The team spent weeks in preparation for the tournament.
examples.zh: 球队为这次锦标赛准备了好几个星期。

definition.en: things done or arranged in advance; the necessary work before an event
definition.zh: 筹备工作；前期安排（为某个活动提前做的具体事项）

examples.en: Wedding preparations can take months.
examples.zh: 婚礼的筹备可能要花好几个月。

examples.en: Final preparations are underway.
examples.zh: 最后的准备工作正在进行中。

definition.en: a substance or product made in a particular way, often for medical, scientific, or cooking use
definition.zh: 制剂；配制品（按特定方法制成的物质或产品，常用于医学、科学或烹饪）

examples.en: This skin cream is a herbal preparation.
examples.zh: 这种护肤霜是一种草本制剂。

examples.en: The lab stored the chemical preparation in a sealed container.
examples.zh: 实验室把这种化学制剂密封保存。

extraExplanation: “Preparation”常和介词搭配：in preparation for + 名词（为……做准备），例如：in preparation for the interview（为面试做准备）。
词根上，prepare（准备）+ -ation（名词后缀）构成 preparation，表示“准备的行为/过程”。

summary.en: A preparationist is someone, or something, connected with teaching that people should prepare themselves—often spiritually—for an important future event.
summary.zh: preparationist 指主张或涉及“应当为重要将来事件（常带宗教含义）作灵性/道德准备”的人或观点。

definition.en: a person who supports or teaches “preparationism,” the idea that people should prepare themselves (often morally or spiritually) for an important future event—especially in a religious context.
definition.zh: 主张或教导“预备主义/预备论”的人；强调人应当为重要将来事件（尤指宗教意义上的）作道德或灵性准备的人。

examples.en: Some early American ministers were preparationists who urged listeners to examine their lives and repent.
examples.zh: 一些早期的美国牧师属于预备主义者，敦促听众省察自身并悔改。

examples.en: In that community, a preparationist approach focused on readiness rather than predicting exact dates.
examples.zh: 在那个社群里，预备主义的做法强调“随时预备”，而不是预测具体日期。

definition.en: relating to the belief or teaching that people should prepare themselves (often spiritually or morally) for a major event, especially in Christian theology.
definition.zh: （尤指基督教神学中）与“应当作灵性或道德准备”的信念或教导有关的。

examples.en: The sermon took a preparationist tone, calling for reflection and change.
examples.zh: 那篇讲道带有预备主义的语气，呼吁反思与改变。

examples.en: They debated preparationist ideas about readiness for judgment.
examples.zh: 他们讨论了关于为审判作准备的预备主义观点。

extraExplanation: “preparationist”并不是日常高频词，更多见于宗教史、神学讨论或学术写作中，常与“为悔改、得救或末世/审判作准备”的思想相关。
词形上由 preparation（准备）+ -ist（……主义者/从事者）构成，因此理解为“强调准备的人/立场”会比较自然。阅读时可结合上下文判断是一般“准备”还是更具体的宗教含义。

summary.en: “Preparations” means the actions and arrangements made to get ready for something; it can also mean prepared products like medical or chemical mixtures (less common).
summary.zh: “preparations”指为某事做的准备工作和安排；也可指配制好的制剂/产品（较少见）。

definition.en: things you do (or arrangements you make) to get ready for something; the process of getting ready
definition.zh: 为某事做的准备工作；准备的过程

examples.en: We made preparations for the trip by booking hotels and packing early.
examples.zh: 我们为旅行做了准备：订酒店并提前收拾行李。

examples.en: The team is in preparation for the final exam.
examples.zh: 团队正在为期末考试做准备。

definition.en: special activities done before a performance, event, or official action
definition.zh: 演出、活动或正式行动前的筹备工作

examples.en: The preparations for the wedding took months.
examples.zh: 婚礼的筹备花了好几个月。

examples.en: Security preparations were increased before the president arrived.
examples.zh: 总统到达前加强了安保准备。

definition.en: (less common) a medicine, chemical mixture, or product that has been prepared for use
definition.zh: （较少见）配制好的药剂、化学制剂或产品

examples.en: This skin preparation should be applied twice a day.
examples.zh: 这种皮肤制剂应每天涂两次。

examples.en: The lab stored the preparation in a sealed container.
examples.zh: 实验室把该制剂存放在密封容器里。

extraExplanation: “preparations”是名词复数，来自单数“preparation”。日常中更常用作不可数名词“preparation”（强调“准备这件事/过程”）：We need more preparation. 当强调“具体的准备事项/安排”时常用复数“preparations”：The preparations are almost finished.
常见搭配：make preparations for…（为……做准备）；in preparation for…（为……做准备）；final preparations（最后的准备工作）。

summary.en: Preaparative means ‘used for preparing’ (adjective) or ‘a preparatory substance/treatment’ (noun), often in technical contexts.
summary.zh: preparative 意为“用于准备的”（形容词），或“预处理剂/预备用品”（名词），多用于学术、医疗与实验室等技术语境。

definition.en: Made for preparing something; used in order to get ready for a later event or action.
definition.zh: 用于准备的；为后续事件或行动做准备的。

examples.en: She took a preparative course before starting medical school.
examples.zh: 她在开始医学院学习前上了一门预备课程。

examples.en: The team held a preparative meeting to review the plan.
examples.zh: 团队开了一次准备会议来复盘计划。

definition.en: A thing (often a medicine, chemical, or treatment) used to prepare for a later process or result.
definition.zh: （常指药物、化学品或处理方法）用于准备后续步骤或效果的东西；预处理剂。

examples.en: This skin preparative helps clean the area before the procedure.
examples.zh: 这种皮肤预处理剂有助于在操作前清洁该区域。

examples.en: The lab used a preparative to isolate the sample more effectively.
examples.zh: 实验室使用了预处理方法来更有效地分离样本。

extraExplanation: “preparative”较常见于学术、医疗、化学与实验室语境，日常英语里更常用“preparatory”（如：preparatory class/exam）或“preparation”。
词源上来自“prepare（准备）”，后缀“-ative”常表示“具有……作用的/与……有关的”。因此它强调“用于准备的功能”。
在化学中，“preparative”常见搭配如“preparative chromatography（制备色谱）”，指以“制备/分离得到产物”为目的，而不是仅用于分析（analytical）。

summary.en: “Preparatively” means “in preparation; as part of getting ready,” but it is formal and uncommon in everyday English.
summary.zh: “preparatively”意为“以准备的方式；作为准备的一部分”，但语体较正式，日常不太常用。

definition.en: In a way that is done in preparation for something; as part of getting ready.
definition.zh: 以准备的方式；作为为某事做准备的一部分。

examples.en: She met with the team preparatively before the official meeting.
examples.zh: 在正式会议前，她先以准备的方式和团队见了面。

examples.en: The documents were reviewed preparatively to avoid mistakes later.
examples.zh: 这些文件先被预先审阅，以避免之后出错。

extraExplanation:
“preparatively”这个词比较少见、偏正式写法。日常英语里更常用：
- “in preparation (for ...)”（为……做准备）
- “as a preparatory step”（作为准备步骤）
- “beforehand / in advance”（提前）
例如："They reviewed the documents in advance." 通常比 "preparatively" 更自然。

构词上：prepare（准备）→ preparatory（准备性的，形容词）→ preparatively（副词）。

summary.en: “Preparatives” means preparations—things done beforehand to get ready; “preparative” can also be an adjective meaning preliminary.
summary.zh: “preparatives”指“准备工作/准备事项”；“preparative”也可作形容词，表示“预备的、前期的”。

definition.en: Actions or things done in advance to get ready for something; preparations (often used in the plural).
definition.zh: 为某事提前做的准备工作或准备事项；准备（常用复数）。

examples.en: The team began the preparatives for the conference weeks in advance.
examples.zh: 团队提前几周就开始为会议做准备工作。

examples.en: Safety preparatives include checking the exits and testing the alarms.
examples.zh: 安全准备包括检查出口和测试警报。

definition.en: Serving to prepare for something; preliminary.
definition.zh: 起准备作用的；预备的；前期的。

examples.en: They held a preparative meeting before the main event.
examples.zh: 在主要活动前他们开了一个预备会议。

extraExplanation: “preparatives”是“preparative”的复数名词形式，但在现代英语里更常见的是用更自然的词：preparations（准备）、preliminary steps/measures（前期措施）。
作为形容词“preparative”偏正式/书面，日常表达里常用：preparatory（预备的）或 preliminary（初步的）。

summary.en: A preparator is a person whose job is to prepare things—often used for museum or gallery staff who ready and install exhibits.
summary.zh: preparator 指负责做准备工作的人员，尤其常用于博物馆/画廊中负责展品准备与安装的工作人员。

definition.en: a person who prepares something (such as materials, food, or arrangements) for use or for an event
definition.zh: 准备者；筹备者（为使用或活动把材料、食物或安排等准备好的人）

examples.en: The museum hired a preparator to ready the artifacts for the exhibition.
examples.zh: 博物馆雇了一位展品准备员来把文物整理好用于展览。

examples.en: In the kitchen, the preparator chopped vegetables and measured spices.
examples.zh: 在厨房里，准备员切菜并量取香料。

definition.en: (specialized) a staff member who prepares and installs objects for display, especially in museums or galleries
definition.zh: （专门用语）展陈准备员；布展人员（尤指在博物馆或画廊中负责准备与安装展品的人）

examples.en: The preparator worked with the curator to mount the sculpture safely.
examples.zh: 展陈准备员与策展人合作，安全地安装了那座雕塑。

examples.en: Before opening night, the gallery’s preparator adjusted the lighting and labels.
examples.zh: 开幕前，画廊的布展人员调整了灯光和标签。

extraExplanation: “preparator”在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的说法是“preparer”（准备者）或按具体工作说“chef/kitchen staff”（厨房人员）、“event planner/organizer”（活动策划/组织者）。
在博物馆语境中，“preparator”是较正式的岗位名称，常与“curator”（策展人）一起出现：curator负责学术与内容，preparator更偏向实物处理、包装、运输、安装与展陈技术。

summary.en: “Preparatorily” means “as preparation; in a way that prepares for something.” It is formal and uncommon.
summary.zh: “preparatorily”意为“作为准备；以准备的方式”，较正式且不常用。

definition.en: In a way that prepares for something; as preparation.
definition.zh: 以准备的方式；作为准备。

examples.en: The team met preparatorily to review the plan before the main meeting.
examples.zh: 团队先开了一个准备性的会，在正式会议前复盘计划。

examples.en: She read the first chapter preparatorily, just to get a sense of the topic.
examples.zh: 她先读了第一章作准备，只是为了先了解主题。

extraExplanation: “preparatorily”比较少见，语气偏正式/书面。在日常英语里更常用的表达是：as preparation, in preparation (for), beforehand, to prepare.
词形来源：preparatory（准备性的，adj.）+ -ly（构成副词）。用在句中通常修饰动词，表示“先做某事以便后续进行”。

summary.en: “Preparatory” means intended to prepare for something; it’s common in phrases like “preparatory course/meeting,” and in school contexts it can mean college-prep.
summary.zh: “Preparatory”表示“为……做准备的/预备的”，常见搭配如“preparatory course/meeting”；在学校语境中也可指“大学预备（升学导向）的”。

definition.en: done in order to prepare for something; serving as preparation.
definition.zh: 为某事做准备的；起准备作用的。

examples.en: She took a preparatory course before starting medical school.
examples.zh: 她在开始医学院学习之前上了一门预备课程。

examples.en: The team held a preparatory meeting to plan the project.
examples.zh: 团队召开了一次筹备会议来规划项目。

definition.en: (especially in school names) intended to prepare students for the next level of education, often college.
definition.zh: （尤用于学校名称）预备性质的；为升入更高阶段（常为大学）做准备的。

examples.en: He attends a college preparatory high school.
examples.zh: 他就读于一所大学预备高中。

examples.en: In the U.S., “prep school” often refers to a private preparatory school.
examples.zh: 在美国，“prep school”常指私立的预备学校。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：preparatory 来自 prepare（准备）+ -tory（“用于……的/与……有关的”形容词后缀）。整体意思就是“用来做准备的”。
用法提示：preparatory 常放在名词前作定语，如 preparatory work/steps/meeting/course。也可与 for 连用：preparatory to/for something（较正式）。
文化语境：在美国教育语境中，preparatory school（或 prep school）常与“私立学校、升学导向”相关，但在不同地区也可能泛指“预科/预备班”。

summary.en: “Prepardon” means to give an advance pardon, or the advance pardon itself, usually in legal or political contexts.
summary.zh: “Prepardon”指“预先赦免/提前赦免”，也可指“预先赦免令”，多用于法律或政治语境。

definition.en: to pardon someone in advance (before they are convicted, or before any formal charges are decided)
definition.zh: 预先赦免；提前赦免（在定罪前或正式处理前先给予赦免）

examples.en: The governor was criticized for trying to prepardon his allies before the investigation ended.
examples.zh: 州长因在调查结束前试图预先赦免盟友而受到批评。

examples.en: Some commentators argued that a prepardon could undermine public trust in the justice system.
examples.zh: 一些评论人士认为，预先赦免可能会削弱公众对司法体系的信任。

definition.en: an advance pardon
definition.zh: 预先赦免（提前发出的赦免令）

examples.en: The court debated whether the prepardon was valid under the constitution.
examples.zh: 法院讨论该预先赦免是否符合宪法。

extraExplanation: “prepardon”不是常见的日常英语词，更常见的表达是“pardon in advance / preemptive pardon（先发制人的赦免）”。它常出现在政治与法律语境（如赦免权、调查、腐败指控等）的讨论中。
构词上：pre-（在……之前）+ pardon（赦免）。因此含义非常直观：在事情“定性”之前先赦免。

summary.en: Prepare means to make ready, to make something (like food or a plan), or to train someone to be ready.
summary.zh: prepare 指“做准备/把……准备好”，也可指“制作（食物、计划等）”或“培养/使胜任”。

definition.en: To make something ready for use or for a future event.
definition.zh: 为使用或未来的事情做准备；把……准备好。

examples.en: I need to prepare dinner before my guests arrive.
examples.zh: 客人到来之前，我需要准备晚餐。

examples.en: The team is preparing for the exam next week.
examples.zh: 团队正在为下周的考试做准备。

definition.en: To create or make something, especially food, a document, or plans.
definition.zh: 制作；调制（尤指食物）；起草（文件）；拟定（计划）。

examples.en: She prepared a simple breakfast of eggs and toast.
examples.zh: 她做了一份简单的早餐：鸡蛋和吐司。

examples.en: A lawyer helped them prepare the contract.
examples.zh: 律师帮助他们起草合同。

definition.en: To train or educate someone so they are ready for a job, task, or future life.
definition.zh: 使（某人）做好准备；培训；培养（使胜任工作/任务/未来生活）。

examples.en: This course prepares students for college writing.
examples.zh: 这门课帮助学生为大学写作做好准备。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：prepare for（为……做准备）、prepare to do（准备做……）、prepare sth（把某物准备好）、be prepared（有准备的/愿意应对的）。
语气区别：prepare 更偏“提前把事情安排好”；get ready 更口语、更偏“临出门前的准备”。

summary.en: “Prepared” means ready (often after planning or doing something in advance).
summary.zh: “Prepared”表示“准备好的”，强调事先安排或处理后处于“随时可应对”的状态。

definition.en: ready for something; having made what is needed in advance.
definition.zh: 准备好的；事先把需要的事情做好、随时可以应对的。

examples.en: I’m prepared for the interview tomorrow.
examples.zh: 我已经为明天的面试做好准备了。

examples.en: Are you prepared to leave now?
examples.zh: 你现在准备好出发了吗？

examples.en: Keep an umbrella so you’re prepared for rain.
examples.zh: 带把伞，这样下雨时你就有准备。

definition.en: made or arranged in advance, especially of food or materials.
definition.zh: （尤指食物或材料）预先做好的；事先准备好的。

examples.en: She brought prepared meals for the week.
examples.zh: 她带了这周的预制餐/提前做好的饭。

examples.en: Use prepared dough to save time.
examples.zh: 用现成/预先和好的面团可以节省时间。

definition.en: trained or educated in a particular way (often used with “well-”).
definition.zh: （常与 well- 连用）受过训练/教育的；有充分准备的。

examples.en: He is well-prepared for college-level work.
examples.zh: 他对大学阶段的学习准备得很充分。

definition.en: ready and willing to do something (often followed by “to”).
definition.zh: 愿意（做某事）；有心理准备（常接 to）。

examples.en: I’m prepared to apologize.
examples.zh: 我愿意道歉。

examples.en: They weren’t prepared to take that risk.
examples.zh: 他们不愿意/没准备好承担那个风险。

extraExplanation: “prepared”是形容词，来自动词“prepare”（准备）。在口语里很常见的搭配有：be prepared for + 名词（为……做好准备）；be prepared to + 动词（准备/愿意做……）。
注意区分：prepared（准备好了的，状态） vs. preparing（正在准备，过程） vs. preparation（名词：准备；筹备）。

summary.en: “Preparedly” means doing something in a prepared, ready, or planned way (formal and not very common).
summary.zh: “preparedly”表示“有准备地、准备充分地”去做某事（较正式且不太常用）。

definition.en: In a prepared way; with prior planning or readiness (often used in formal writing).
definition.zh: 有准备地；事先准备好地（常见于较正式的表达）。

examples.en: She spoke preparedly, with notes arranged in front of her.
examples.zh: 她有准备地发言，面前把笔记都整理好了。

examples.en: The team responded preparedly to the emergency drill.
examples.zh: 团队对紧急演练作出了有准备的反应。

definition.en: Intentionally and with calm control; not impulsively (less common).
definition.zh: 从容而有意地；不冲动地（较少见）。

examples.en: He preparedly chose his words to avoid hurting anyone.
examples.zh: 他从容地斟酌措辞，避免伤到任何人。

extraExplanation: “preparedly”在现代英语里不算常用，更自然的说法通常是：with preparation / in a prepared manner / after preparing / ready and willing。
拼写小提示：prepared + -ly。也可以把它理解为“像prepared那样（以准备好的状态）去做”。

summary.en: Preparedness means the state of being ready, especially for emergencies or difficult situations.
summary.zh: Preparedness 指“处于准备就绪的状态/程度”，常用于应急或困难情境。

definition.en: the state of being ready to deal with a situation, especially an emergency or something difficult
definition.zh: 准备状态；应对（尤指紧急或困难情况）的准备程度

examples.en: The school reviewed its emergency preparedness plan after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，学校复盘了它的应急准备方案。

examples.en: Good preparedness can reduce panic when something unexpected happens.
examples.zh: 良好的准备能在突发情况发生时减少恐慌。

examples.en: Household preparedness includes storing water and keeping a first-aid kit.
examples.zh: 家庭准备包括储备饮用水并备好急救箱。

definition.en: readiness gained through training and planning (often used in workplaces, the military, and public health)
definition.zh: 通过训练与规划获得的准备度（常用于职场、军队、公共卫生等语境）

examples.en: The team’s preparedness improved after regular drills.
examples.zh: 经过定期演练，团队的准备度提高了。

examples.en: Public health preparedness is essential for responding to outbreaks.
examples.zh: 公共卫生准备对疫情暴发的应对至关重要。

extraExplanation: “preparedness”来自形容词“prepared”（准备好的）+ 名词后缀“-ness”（表示“……的状态/性质”）。因此它强调的是“准备的状态/程度”，比单次行为“preparation”（准备这一行为/过程）更偏向“是否随时能应对”。
常见搭配：emergency/disaster preparedness（应急/防灾准备）、preparedness plan（准备/应急预案）、preparedness drill（应急演练）、level of preparedness（准备程度）。

summary.en: “Preparednesses” means multiple kinds or instances of preparedness (states of readiness), mainly in formal writing.
summary.zh: “Preparednesses”表示多种或多个“准备程度/准备状态”，多用于较正式的写作。

definition.en: the plural form of preparedness; multiple states or levels of being ready (often in different places, teams, or situations)
definition.zh: preparedness 的复数形式；指多个“准备就绪”的状态/程度（常用于不同地点、团队或情境）

examples.en: The report compared emergency preparednesses across several counties.
examples.zh: 报告比较了几个县的应急准备水平。

examples.en: Hospitals reviewed their preparednesses for earthquakes and floods.
examples.zh: 各医院复盘了它们对地震和洪水的应对准备情况。

extraExplanation: “Preparedness”通常是不可数名词（表示总体的‘准备程度’），所以日常更常说：overall preparedness / level of preparedness。
当你需要强调“不同类型/不同对象的准备状态”时，才可能用复数 preparednesses（多见于政策、军事、公共卫生等正式语境）。

summary.en: Preparement is a rare word meaning “preparation” or “the act of preparing,” but it’s uncommon in modern English.
summary.zh: Preparement 是个很少见的词，意思接近“preparation（准备、准备工作）”，但在现代英语中不常用。

definition.en: the act or process of preparing; preparation; arrangements made in advance
definition.zh: 准备的行为或过程；准备工作；事先做好的安排

examples.en: The team’s preparement for the trip took several days.
examples.zh: 团队为这次旅行做准备花了好几天。

examples.en: After weeks of preparement, the event finally began.
examples.zh: 经过数周的准备，活动终于开始了。

extraExplanation: “preparement”在现代英语中非常少见，很多情况下会被认为是不标准或拼写/用词不自然。更常用的表达是“preparation”（准备、准备工作）或“arrangements / planning”（安排/规划）。
如果你原本想表达“预付款”，正确的词通常是“prepayment”，而不是“preparement”。
在阅读较旧文本或某些方言/文学语境中可能会见到“preparement”表示“准备”，但在日常写作与考试中建议用“preparation”。

summary.en: Preparental means ‘before becoming a parent’ or relating to the period before parenting begins.
summary.zh: preparental 表示“成为父母之前的”，或与为人父母开始前这一阶段有关。

definition.en: Happening or existing before someone becomes a parent; relating to the time before parenting begins.
definition.zh: 发生在成为父母之前的；与“为人父母之前”这一阶段有关的。

examples.en: Many couples attend preparental classes to learn about newborn care.
examples.zh: 许多夫妻会参加“为人父母之前”的课程，学习新生儿护理。

examples.en: Preparental counseling can help people talk openly about expectations and responsibilities.
examples.zh: 为人父母之前的咨询可以帮助人们坦诚讨论期望与责任。

examples.en: Good preparental planning often includes budgeting, childcare options, and family support.
examples.zh: 良好的为人父母之前的规划通常包括做预算、选择托育方案以及争取家庭支持。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，“parental”表示“父母的/与父母有关的”。因此 preparental 多见于心理学、医学或家庭教育语境，强调从“尚未为人父母”到“即将成为父母”的准备阶段。日常口语里更常用 before becoming parents / before having kids 来表达。

summary.en: “Preparer” means a person who gets something ready, sometimes specifically someone who prepares food.
summary.zh: “preparer”指“准备者”，也可特指餐饮行业的“备餐人员”。

definition.en: a person who prepares something; someone who gets things ready in advance
definition.zh: 准备者；把事先需要的东西准备好的人

examples.en: The meeting preparer sent the agenda to everyone the day before.
examples.zh: 会议准备者在前一天把议程发给了所有人。

examples.en: As the trip’s main preparer, she booked the hotel and planned the route.
examples.zh: 作为旅行的主要准备者，她订了酒店并规划了路线。

definition.en: someone whose job is to prepare food (a food preparer)
definition.zh: （餐饮）备餐人员；食物准备员

examples.en: A food preparer washed and cut the vegetables before the chef started cooking.
examples.zh: 厨师开始烹饪前，备餐人员把蔬菜洗净并切好。

examples.en: The restaurant is hiring preparers for the morning shift.
examples.zh: 这家餐厅正在招聘早班备餐人员。

extraExplanation: “preparer”在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的表达是“the person who prepared it / someone who prepares…”；在餐饮语境里常用“food preparer”或“prep cook”。
不要和“prepper”（末日生存主义者）混淆：prepper是特定文化语境里的词，指为灾难做长期囤货与生存准备的人。

summary.en: “Preparers” means people who prepare something; it can also specifically mean people who prepare taxes or official documents.
summary.zh: “preparers”指“准备/编制某物的人”；也可特指“报税或准备官方文件的人（税务申报员等）”。

definition.en: People who prepare something (materials, plans, documents, food, etc.).
definition.zh: 准备某事物的人（如材料、计划、文件、食物等）。

examples.en: The preparers of the report checked every number twice before publishing it.
examples.zh: 报告的编制者在发布前把每个数字都复核了两遍。

examples.en: Event preparers arrived early to set up chairs and test the sound system.
examples.zh: 活动筹备人员很早就到了，摆好椅子并测试音响系统。

definition.en: People whose job is to prepare official forms or documents, especially taxes.
definition.zh: 负责准备官方表格或文件的人，尤指报税人员（税务申报员）。

examples.en: Many families hire tax preparers to file their returns correctly.
examples.zh: 很多家庭会雇税务申报员来正确报税。

examples.en: The tax preparers asked for last year’s W-2 forms and receipts.
examples.zh: 税务申报员要求提供去年的 W-2 表和收据。

extraExplanation: “preparers”是名词“preparer”的复数，来自动词“prepare”（准备）。在日常语境里多指“负责准备/编制的人”；在美国语境中很常见的固定搭配是“tax preparer”（报税人员）。
在正式写作中，“preparers”常出现在文件的署名或说明里，例如“prepared by the preparers of this report”（由本报告编制者准备）。口语里也可用更自然的说法如“the people who prepared it”（准备它的人）。

summary.en: “Prepares” means “gets ready” or “makes something/someone ready,” used with he/she/it in the present tense.
summary.zh: “prepares”表示“准备/使就绪/使某人做好准备”，用于一般现在时第三人称单数（he/she/it）。

definition.en: (Third-person singular of “prepare”) to make something ready for use or for an event; to get things organized in advance.
definition.zh: （prepare 的第三人称单数）准备；使……就绪；为某事提前安排、组织。

examples.en: She prepares dinner every evening.
examples.zh: 她每天晚上准备晚餐。

examples.en: The team prepares a report for the meeting.
examples.zh: 团队为会议准备一份报告。

examples.en: He prepares carefully before an interview.
examples.zh: 他在面试前会认真准备。

definition.en: To train or help someone become ready for a future task, role, or situation.
definition.zh: 使（某人）为将来的任务、角色或情况做好准备。

examples.en: This course prepares students for college writing.
examples.zh: 这门课帮助学生为大学写作做好准备。

examples.en: The coach prepares the players for the final match.
examples.zh: 教练让队员为决赛做好准备。

extraExplanation: “prepares”是一般现在时的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it prepares）。常见搭配：prepare for + 名词/动名词（prepare for the exam 为考试做准备）；prepare to + 动词原形（prepare to leave 准备离开）；prepare sth for sb（为某人准备某物）。

summary.en: “Preparietal” means situated in front of the parietal bone/region (a rare medical/anatomy term).
summary.zh: “Preparietal”指“位于顶骨/顶区之前的”，是较少见的医学/解剖学术语。

definition.en: (Anatomy) Located in front of, or occurring before, the parietal bone or parietal region (the area related to the parietal bones/lobes).
definition.zh: （解剖）位于顶骨/顶区之前的；或发生在顶骨/顶区之前的。

examples.en: The report describes a small preparietal area of swelling near the front of the skull.
examples.zh: 报告描述了靠近前额、位于顶骨之前的一小片肿胀区域。

examples.en: In some anatomy texts, a “preparietal” landmark is mentioned to indicate a position anterior to the parietal bone.
examples.zh: 在一些解剖学教材中，会用“preparietal（顶骨前）”这个标志来表示位于顶骨前方的位置。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常英语中很少见，多用于医学/解剖学写作与专业描述。结构上是前缀 pre-（“在……之前/前方”）+ parietal（“顶骨的；顶叶的”）。parietal 源自拉丁语 paries（“墙”），引申为“壁/壁层”，所以在医学里也常见到 parietal pleura（壁层胸膜）等表达。

summary.en: “Preparing” means getting ready or making something ready (the -ing form of “prepare”).
summary.zh: “preparing”表示正在做准备或把某物准备好，是“prepare”的 -ing 形式。

definition.en: (present participle of “prepare”) getting ready for something; making something ready
definition.zh: （prepare 的现在分词）在为某事做准备；把某物准备好

examples.en: She is preparing for her final exam.
examples.zh: 她正在为期末考试做准备。

examples.en: I’m preparing dinner right now.
examples.zh: 我正在准备晚饭。

examples.en: They are preparing a report for the meeting.
examples.zh: 他们正在为会议准备一份报告。

definition.en: the act or process of getting ready; preparation
definition.zh: 准备的行为或过程；筹备

examples.en: Careful preparing can save you time later.
examples.zh: 认真准备可以帮你之后节省时间。

examples.en: The preparing for the trip took a whole week.
examples.zh: 为这次旅行做准备花了一整周。

extraExplanation:
用法小提示：
1) prepare for + 名词/动名词：prepare for an exam / prepare for moving.
2) prepare to + 动词原形：prepare to leave（准备离开）。
3) prepare + 名词：prepare dinner / prepare a speech（准备晚餐/演讲）。

summary.en: “Preparingly” means “in a way that prepares for something,” but it’s uncommon in everyday English.
summary.zh: “Preparingly”意为“以准备的方式/作为准备”，但在日常英语中并不常用。

definition.en: In a way that prepares for something; as preparation.
definition.zh: 以准备的方式；作为准备。

examples.en: The team met preparingly before the big presentation.
examples.zh: 团队在重要汇报前召开会议作准备。

examples.en: She read the guidelines preparingly so she wouldn’t miss any details.
examples.zh: 她为避免遗漏细节，先阅读了指南作准备。

extraExplanation:
“preparingly”比较少见、偏书面或刻意用法。日常表达更常用：
- “in preparation (for ...)”（为……做准备）
- “as preparation” （作为准备）
- “in a preparatory way” （以准备性的方式）
例如：They met in preparation for the presentation.（他们为汇报做准备而开会。）

summary.en: Preparliamentary means “before a parliament is formally established or begins work.”
summary.zh: preparliamentary 指“议会正式成立或开始运作之前的”。

definition.en: Happening before a parliament is officially formed, seated, or begins its formal work; relating to the period before a parliamentary government starts operating.
definition.zh: 议会成立、就职或正式开始运作之前发生的；与议会制度开始运作前的时期有关的。

examples.en: The country held preparliamentary talks to agree on election rules.
examples.zh: 该国举行了议会成立前的会谈，以就选举规则达成一致。

examples.en: Preparliamentary negotiations helped the parties form a coalition.
examples.zh: 议会成立前的谈判帮助各党组成联合政府。

extraExplanation: 这个词多见于政治学、新闻与历史写作中，用来描述“议会正式开幕/组建之前”的过渡阶段，例如制宪、起草议事规则、政党协商组阁、选举安排等。
构词法：pre-（在……之前）+ parliamentary（议会的）。语体偏正式，日常口语里较少用。

summary.en: A rare anatomical adjective meaning “in front of the occipital (back-of-head) area.”
summary.zh: 一个较少见的解剖学形容词，意思是“位于枕部（头后部）之前的/枕前的”。

definition.en: (Anatomy, rare) Located in front of the occipital region (the back part of the head), especially near the boundary between the parietal and occipital areas of the skull or brain.
definition.zh: （解剖学，少见）位于枕部（头后部）之前的；尤指靠近顶叶与枕叶（或顶骨与枕骨）交界附近的区域。

examples.en: The report describes a small lesion in the preparoccipital area.
examples.zh: 报告描述在前枕区（preparoccipital area）有一个小病灶。

examples.en: Pain was noted in the preparoccipital region after the injury.
examples.zh: 受伤后在前枕部区域出现疼痛。

extraExplanation: “preparoccipital”在现代英语医学写作中非常少见；很多时候你会看到更常用的写法如“preoccipital”（枕前的）或“parieto-occipital”（顶枕的/顶枕交界的）。如果这是从某篇论文或影像报告里摘出来的词，也可能是作者的变体写法或拼写差异。

summary.en: Preparoxysmal describes a word whose main stress is on the fourth syllable from the end.
summary.zh: Preparoxysmal 指一个词的主重音落在倒数第四个音节上。

definition.en: (In linguistics/poetry) Having the main stress on the fourth syllable from the end of a word.
definition.zh: （语言学/诗学）指一个词的主重音落在倒数第四个音节上。

examples.en: In some analyses, “photographically” is preparoxysmal because the stress falls on the fourth syllable from the end.
examples.zh: 在一些分析中，photographically 属于 preparoxysmal，因为重音落在倒数第四个音节上。

examples.en: Preparoxysmal stress patterns are less common in English but may appear in longer words.
examples.zh: preparoxysmal 这种重音模式在英语中不太常见，但可能出现在较长的单词里。

extraExplanation: 这个词主要用于“重音位置”的描述，常见于语言学、韵律学（诗歌格律）或词典式的分析中。
可以把它和更常见的术语对比来记：oxytone（末音节重音）、paroxytone（倒数第二重音）、proparoxytone（倒数第三重音）；preparoxysmal 则是更往前一位——倒数第四重音。

summary.en: A rare verb meaning “to partake beforehand.”
summary.zh: 一个较少见的动词，意思是“提前参与/提前享用”。

definition.en: to take part in or enjoy something in advance; to partake beforehand (rare).
definition.zh: 提前参加或提前享用；事先参与（较少见）。

examples.en: Guests may prepartake in a tasting menu before the main banquet.
examples.zh: 宾客可以在正式宴会前先提前品尝试吃菜单。

examples.en: Some hikers prepartake in a short warm-up walk before the long climb.
examples.zh: 有些徒步者会在长距离攀登前先提前走一小段热身。

extraExplanation: “prepartake”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ partake（“参与/分享/享用”）构成，但在现代英语里非常少见，常用更自然的表达：take part in beforehand / sample in advance / have a preview / pregame（口语，常指比赛前聚会饮酒）。
在正式写作中，如果想表达“提前体验/预先参与”，通常建议改用更常见的动词搭配，以避免读者觉得生僻或不地道。

summary.en: “Prepartaken” is a rare form meaning “having taken part beforehand,” the past participle of the uncommon verb “prepartake.”
summary.zh: “prepartaken”很罕见，意思是“事先参与过/预先分享过”，是少见动词“prepartake”的过去分词。

definition.en: (rare, usually past participle) Having taken part in something beforehand; having shared in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见，通常作过去分词）预先参与过；事先分享/分担过。

examples.en: The guests had prepartaken of refreshments before the ceremony began.
examples.zh: 客人们在仪式开始前就已经先用过茶点了。

examples.en: She felt less nervous because she had prepartaken in a short rehearsal.
examples.zh: 因为她事先参加过一次简短彩排，所以没那么紧张了。

definition.en: Past participle of the rare verb “prepartake” (to take part in something in advance).
definition.zh: 罕见动词 prepartake（预先参与）的过去分词形式。

examples.en: They had prepartaken of the meal earlier that day.
examples.zh: 他们那天早些时候就先吃过那顿饭了。

extraExplanation: “prepartaken”非常少见，更常见、自然的表达是：had already taken part / had participated beforehand / had eaten earlier（视语境而定）。
构词上是 pre-（预先）+ partake（参与、分享）；但现代英语里更倾向用 participate 或 take part 来表达同样意思。
如果你是在旧文本、宗教或法律风格较强的文本里见到它，可能是为了营造古雅或正式语气。

summary.en: “Prepartaking” is a rare word meaning taking part in something beforehand (participating in advance).
summary.zh: “prepartaking”是个很少见的词，意思是事先参与、提前参加。

definition.en: (Rare) taking part in something beforehand; participating in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见）事先参与；提前参加。

examples.en: By reading the materials early, she felt like she was prepartaking in the discussion before class even began.
examples.zh: 通过提前阅读材料，她感觉自己在上课开始前就已经“预先参与”了讨论。

examples.en: Some historians describe early rituals as a kind of prepartaking in the feast to come.
examples.zh: 一些历史学者把早期仪式描述为对即将到来的宴会的一种“预先参与”。

definition.en: The act of prepartaking; an advance share or participation (very uncommon).
definition.zh: （极罕见）预先参与这一行为；提前的分担或分享。

examples.en: In his notes, he mentions a prepartaking of responsibilities before the official agreement was signed.
examples.zh: 在他的笔记里，他提到在正式协议签署前就提前分担了一部分责任。

extraExplanation: “prepartaking”通常可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ partake（参与/分享）的组合，但它不是常见标准词汇，多见于少量写作或学术/仿古语境。日常英语里更自然的表达是 “participating in advance / taking part ahead of time / getting involved early”。
拼写上容易与 “preparing” 或 “partaking” 混淆；如果你是想表达“提前准备”，常用词是 “preparing / preparation”。

summary.en: “Preparticipation” refers to something (especially a medical screening) done before taking part in an activity, commonly sports.
summary.zh: “Preparticipation”指在参加活动（尤其体育运动）之前进行的事情，常指参加前体检/筛查。

definition.en: (often in sports or medicine) happening before someone takes part in an activity; used especially for health or safety checks.
definition.zh: （常用于体育或医疗）在参加某项活动之前进行的；尤指为健康或安全所做的检查/评估。

examples.en: All athletes must complete a preparticipation physical exam before the season starts.
examples.zh: 所有运动员在赛季开始前都必须完成参加前体检。

examples.en: The clinic offers preparticipation screening for students joining school teams.
examples.zh: 该诊所为加入校队的学生提供参加前筛查。

definition.en: A health or safety evaluation done before participation (short for “preparticipation evaluation/exam”).
definition.zh: 参加前评估/体检（“preparticipation evaluation/exam”的简略说法）。

examples.en: I scheduled a preparticipation to make sure my knee is ready for training.
examples.zh: 我预约了参加前评估，确认膝盖是否适合训练。

examples.en: The preparticipation includes questions about asthma and past injuries.
examples.zh: 参加前评估包括关于哮喘和既往伤病的问题。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常英语中不算常见，更多出现在学校体育、职业运动队、体检表格或运动医学（sports medicine）里。最常见搭配是 preparticipation physical（参加前体检）和 preparticipation evaluation (PPE)（参加前评估）。词形结构是 pre-（在……之前）+ participation（参与/参加）。

summary.en: Prepartisan means “before becoming partisan,” often describing a stage or approach not yet shaped by party loyalty.
summary.zh: Prepartisan 指“在党派化之前”，常形容尚未被党派忠诚影响的阶段或做法。

definition.en: Before a person becomes strongly aligned with a political party; describing an early stage when views are not yet party-driven (often said of children or a “pre-party” political mindset).
definition.zh: 在一个人强烈认同某个政党之前的；形容尚未被党派立场驱动的早期阶段（常用于儿童或“尚未党派化”的政治心态）。

examples.en: Some educators try to teach civics in a prepartisan way, before students feel pressure to pick a side.
examples.zh: 一些教育者尝试用一种“prepartisan（尚未党派化）”的方式教授公民教育，在学生感到必须选边站之前。

examples.en: He describes his childhood as prepartisan—curious about issues but not loyal to any party.
examples.zh: 他把自己的童年形容为 prepartisan：对议题好奇，但不效忠任何政党。

extraExplanation: “prepartisan”并不是非常常见的标准词汇，更常见的表达是“nonpartisan（无党派的）”或“bipartisan（两党合作的）”。“prepartisan”强调的是“时间/阶段在前”：还没进入党派对立的框架。
它常出现在美国政治评论、教育讨论或社论语境中，用来呼吁在“党派标签”介入之前先建立对事实、制度与公共讨论的理解。

summary.en: “Prepartition” is a rare word meaning “before a partition,” and in some technical contexts it can mean “to partition in advance.”
summary.zh: “prepartition”较罕见，主要表示“分割/划分之前”；在少数技术语境中也可作动词表示“提前分区/预先划分”。

definition.en: (Rare) The state or period before something is divided into parts, especially before an official political or administrative division (a “partition”).
definition.zh: （罕见）在某事被划分为若干部分之前的状态或时期，尤指在官方的政治或行政“分割/划分（partition）”之前。

examples.en: Some families kept records from the prepartition period, before the border was drawn.
examples.zh: 一些家庭保留了分割前时期的记录，也就是边界被划定之前。

examples.en: The archive contains prepartition maps showing older place names.
examples.zh: 档案里有分割前的地图，上面标注着更早的地名。

definition.en: (Computing, rare) To divide data or a system into parts in advance; to partition beforehand.
definition.zh: （计算机领域，罕见）预先把数据或系统分成若干部分；提前分区/分片。

examples.en: They prepartition the dataset by region to speed up later queries.
examples.zh: 他们按地区对数据集进行预先分区，以加快后续查询。

examples.en: If you prepartition the disk, installation can be smoother.
examples.zh: 如果你提前给硬盘分区，安装过程可能更顺利。

extraExplanation:
“prepartition”不是常见英语词，更常见的相关词是：
1) preparation（准备）—拼写很像，很多学习者会把它误写成 prepartition。
2) pre-partition（分割前的，作形容词更自然）：如 pre-partition India（印巴分治前的印度）。在正式写作中，通常用带连字符的 pre-partition 或直接说 before the partition。

summary.en: Prepartnership refers to the period or actions before a partnership is formally created.
summary.zh: prepartnership 指正式合伙关系成立之前的时期或相关行为/安排。

definition.en: (Business/legal, uncommon) The time, stage, or arrangements that happen before a formal partnership is created.
definition.zh: （商业/法律，用法较少）在正式合伙关系成立之前的阶段、时期或相关安排。

examples.en: During the prepartnership stage, they discussed roles, profits, and responsibilities.
examples.zh: 在合伙前阶段，他们讨论了分工、利润和责任。

examples.en: The lawyers reviewed emails from the prepartnership period to understand each person’s intentions.
examples.zh: 律师审查了合伙成立前期间的邮件，以了解各方的真实意图。

definition.en: Occurring or existing before a partnership is officially formed.
definition.zh: 发生在正式合伙成立之前的；合伙前的。

examples.en: They signed a prepartnership confidentiality agreement before sharing financial data.
examples.zh: 在共享财务数据之前，他们签署了合伙前保密协议。

examples.en: Clear prepartnership conversations can prevent future conflict.
examples.zh: 清晰的合伙前沟通可以减少未来的冲突。

extraExplanation: “prepartnership”不是很常见；更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-partnership”，尤其在商业合同或法律语境中（如 pre-partnership agreement / pre-partnership discussions）。
在法律语境里，人们有时会查看“合伙成立前”的沟通与行为，用来判断是否已经存在某种事实上的合作关系或承诺；但具体效力取决于地区法律与合同文本。

summary.en: “Prepartook” is a rare/archaic form meaning “partook beforehand” or “shared in advance.”
summary.zh: “prepartook”是罕见/古体用法，意为“提前分用/参与”，相当于“partook beforehand”。

definition.en: (Rare/archaic) to take part in, share, eat, or drink beforehand; to “partake” in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见/古体）预先参与、分享，或预先吃/喝；相当于“提前分用/享用”。

examples.en: They prepartook of the meal before the guests arrived.
examples.zh: 客人到来之前，他们先用了餐。

examples.en: In some older religious writing, people are said to have prepartook of sacred food.
examples.zh: 在一些较早的宗教文字里，人们被写作“预先领受/享用”圣食。

extraExplanation: “prepartook”并不是现代英语里的常用词，很多读者会把它当作拼写错误或临时造词。它可以理解为 pre-（提前）+ partook（partake 的过去式，意为“分用/参与/享用”）。
如果你是在某段特定文本里看到它（例如宗教/历史文献或仿古文体），语境通常是在强调“在某件事发生之前就已经参与/领受”。现代写法更常用：had already partaken / partook beforehand / ate beforehand。

summary.en: Prepartum means ‘before childbirth’ (during pregnancy, especially near delivery).
summary.zh: prepartum 指“分娩前的/产前的”（妊娠期，尤指临近分娩）。

definition.en: (Medical) happening before childbirth; during pregnancy, especially the period shortly before delivery.
definition.zh: （医学）分娩前的；妊娠期的（尤指临近生产前的一段时间）。

examples.en: Prepartum checkups help doctors monitor the baby’s growth and the mother’s health.
examples.zh: 产前检查能帮助医生监测胎儿发育和母亲健康。

examples.en: She attended a prepartum class to learn breathing techniques for labor.
examples.zh: 她参加了产前课程，学习分娩时的呼吸技巧。

extraExplanation: “prepartum”主要用于医学或护理语境，日常英语里更常见的说法是“prenatal”（产前的）或“antenatal”（英式更常用）。
词根提示：pre-（在……之前）+ partum（分娩，来自拉丁语 *parere* “生产、分娩”）。与之相对的常见词是“postpartum”（产后）。

summary.en: “Prepaste” means to put paste or glue on something ahead of time, or the item that has already been pre-coated with paste.
summary.zh: “prepaste”指在正式粘贴前先涂胶/上浆，也可指已预先涂胶的材料或贴纸。

definition.en: to apply paste or glue to something in advance, before the main assembly, mounting, or sticking step
definition.zh: （在正式粘贴/装配前）预先上浆；预先涂胶

examples.en: Prepaste the label so it won’t curl when you stick it on the box.
examples.zh: 先把标签预先上浆，这样贴到盒子上时就不会卷边。

examples.en: The technician prepasted the paper backing before mounting the photo.
examples.zh: 技术人员在装裱照片前先把底纸预先涂胶。

definition.en: a piece of material (such as paper or a label) that has been pre-coated with paste or glue
definition.zh: （已预先涂胶的）贴纸；预涂胶材料

examples.en: Use a prepaste if you need a quick, clean application.
examples.zh: 如果你需要快速又干净的粘贴方式，就用预涂胶贴纸。

extraExplanation: “prepaste”在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-paste”，或改用更通用的说法：apply paste/glue beforehand / pre-coat with paste.
它多出现在印刷、装裱、包装、手工制作等较“工艺/流程”语境中；如果你在正式写作中使用，建议根据领域选择更标准的术语。

summary.en: Prepatellar means “in front of the kneecap,” commonly used in medical contexts like prepatellar bursitis.
summary.zh: prepatellar 意为“髌骨（膝盖骨）前方的”，常用于医学表达，如髌前滑囊炎。

definition.en: Situated in front of the kneecap (patella); relating to the area just in front of the patella.
definition.zh: 位于髌骨（膝盖骨）前方的；与髌骨前方区域有关的。

examples.en: The doctor noted swelling in the prepatellar area of his right knee.
examples.zh: 医生注意到他右膝髌前区域有肿胀。

examples.en: Prepatellar pain can get worse when you kneel for a long time.
examples.zh: 髌前疼痛在长时间跪地时可能会加重。

definition.en: Used in medical terms (especially “prepatellar bursa” or “prepatellar bursitis”) describing inflammation or structures in front of the kneecap.
definition.zh: （医学用语）常用于“髌前滑囊/髌前滑囊炎”等，指髌骨前方结构或其炎症。

examples.en: He was diagnosed with prepatellar bursitis after weeks of working on his knees.
examples.zh: 他因连续数周跪地工作而被诊断为髌前滑囊炎。

examples.en: Treatment for prepatellar bursitis often starts with rest and avoiding kneeling.
examples.zh: 髌前滑囊炎的治疗通常从休息和避免跪地开始。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前/前方”，“patellar”来自 patella（髌骨、膝盖骨）。合在一起，prepatellar 就是“髌骨前方的”。
这个词多见于医学或运动损伤语境，常与 bursa（滑囊）/ bursitis（滑囊炎）搭配；日常口语里更常说 “in front of the kneecap（在膝盖骨前方）”。

summary.en: Prepatent describes an early stage that exists but is not yet detectable or obvious, especially in infections.
summary.zh: prepatent 指“已经存在但尚不可检出/不明显”的早期阶段，尤用于感染或寄生虫学语境。

definition.en: (Medicine/biology) Not yet detectable, obvious, or diagnosable; describing the early stage of an infection or condition before it can be found by tests or observation.
definition.zh: （医学/生物）未达可检出、可观察或可确诊的；指感染或疾病在检测/观察尚无法发现之前的早期阶段。

examples.en: The parasite is present in a prepatent stage, so the stool test may still be negative.
examples.zh: 寄生虫处于前显（未达可检出）阶段，所以粪便检查可能仍然是阴性。

examples.en: Researchers measured how long the prepatent period lasted in each group of animals.
examples.zh: 研究人员测量了每组动物的前显期持续多长时间。

extraExplanation: 这个词最常见于寄生虫学与传染病学：prepatent period（前显期/未检出期）指“从感染发生到第一次能被检测出来（如卵、虫体、病原体出现或可被实验室检出）之间的时间”。它强调“检测上还看不见”，不等同于没有感染。
词源上 pre- 表示“在……之前”，patent 在这里表示“明显的、可见的”。不要与“专利（a patent）”的常见含义混淆。

summary.en: Prepatrician means “before the patrician (Roman noble) class or its social system became established,” used mainly in historical or academic contexts.
summary.zh: prepatrician 指“在罗马贵族阶层（patricians）或其社会制度确立之前的”，多用于历史或学术语境。

definition.en: (especially in Roman history) existing or happening before the patrician class became established or dominant; from an early stage before the patrician–plebeian social system was clearly formed.
definition.zh: （尤指罗马史）指在贵族（patricians）阶层形成或占主导之前就存在的；属于贵族—平民阶层制度尚未清晰确立之前的早期阶段。

examples.en: Some historians use “prepatrician Rome” to talk about the earliest period of the city’s social development.
examples.zh: 一些历史学家用“prepatrician Rome（前贵族时期的罗马）”来指该城邦社会发展的最早阶段。

examples.en: The essay discusses prepatrician religious practices that may have survived into later Roman traditions.
examples.zh: 这篇文章讨论了一些前贵族时期的宗教习俗，它们可能延续到了后来的罗马传统中。

definition.en: (broader, rare) before or earlier than a patrician group or patrician control in a society; pre-aristocratic.
definition.zh: （更广义、少见）指在某个社会中，贵族群体出现之前或贵族统治之前的；“前贵族”的。

examples.en: The author compares prepatrician leadership structures with later aristocratic rule.
examples.zh: 作者把前贵族时期的领导结构与后来的贵族统治作了比较。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多用于学术写作或历史讨论。它由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ patrician（罗马“贵族”，引申为“上层阶级/贵族的”）构成。
在罗马语境里，patricians 指传统贵族阶层，与 plebeians（平民）相对；因此 prepatrician 常用来标记“在这种阶层对立形成之前的阶段”。

summary.en: Prepatriotic (rare) describes something from before strong patriotism became common, or a person not yet showing patriotic feeling.
summary.zh: Prepatriotic（罕见）指强烈爱国主义尚未普遍出现之前的时期/事物，或指一个人尚未表现出爱国情感。

definition.en: (Rare) Existing or happening before a time when strong patriotism becomes common; from an earlier, less nationalistic period.
definition.zh: （罕见）指在强烈爱国主义普遍出现之前就存在的；属于较早、较不强调民族国家认同的时期。

examples.en: Some historians describe the colonies as a prepatriotic society, where local identity mattered more than national feeling.
examples.zh: 一些历史学者把殖民地描述为“前爱国主义”的社会，在那里地方认同比国家情感更重要。

examples.en: In the novel’s opening chapters, the characters live in a prepatriotic world, loyal to family and town rather than a flag.
examples.zh: 在小说开头几章里，人物生活在一个“前爱国主义”的世界中，他们忠于家庭与小镇，而不是国旗。

definition.en: (Rare) Not yet showing patriotic feelings; not yet strongly devoted to one’s country.
definition.zh: （罕见）尚未表现出爱国情感的；对国家的忠诚与热情尚未形成或不强烈的。

examples.en: He was prepatriotic at first, caring more about personal freedom than national pride.
examples.zh: 起初他还处于“前爱国主义”的状态，更在意个人自由而不是民族自豪感。

examples.en: The speech aims to move a prepatriotic audience toward a shared sense of national purpose.
examples.zh: 这篇演讲旨在把尚未产生强烈爱国意识的听众，带向共同的国家目标感。

extraExplanation: “prepatriotic”不是高频词，更常见的写法是加连字符的“pre-patriotic”。它多用于历史、社会学或文学评论，强调“在爱国主义成为主流之前的阶段/状态”。
构词：前缀“pre-”（在……之前）+“patriotic”（爱国的）。在正式写作中，若你不确定读者是否熟悉该词，可以改用更直白的表达，如“before widespread patriotism”或“before nationalist sentiment grew”。

summary.en: Prepave means to prepare in advance, often “to prepave the way” for something.
summary.zh: prepave 指“提前铺垫/预先准备”，常见于“prepave the way（为……铺路）”。

definition.en: to prepare in advance, especially by doing work that makes something easier later; often used in the phrase “prepave the way.”
definition.zh: （尤指提前做准备工作以）铺垫、预先安排；常用于短语“prepave the way（为……铺路）”。

examples.en: Her early research helped prepave the way for the new vaccine.
examples.zh: 她早期的研究为新疫苗的研发铺平了道路。

examples.en: Clear rules can prepave the way for smoother teamwork.
examples.zh: 清晰的规则能为更顺畅的团队合作打下基础。

extraExplanation: “Prepave”不是特别常见的独立动词，更常见的表达是“pave the way（为……铺路/创造条件）”。“Prepave”通过前缀pre-（预先）强调“提前铺垫”，在正式写作或修辞性表达中偶尔出现。
近义表达可用：prepare the ground（打基础）、lay the groundwork（奠定基础）、set the stage（创造条件）。日常口语里通常更推荐这些更常见的说法。

summary.en: “Prepaved” means already paved in advance; it can also be the past form of “prepave.”
summary.zh: “prepaved”表示“预先铺好的/已提前铺设的”，也可作动词“prepave”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (of a road or surface) paved in advance; already paved before something is built or used.
definition.zh: （道路或地面）预先铺好的；在建设或使用前就已铺设完成的。

examples.en: The construction site had a prepaved access road for trucks.
examples.zh: 工地有一条预先铺好的通道，方便卡车进出。

examples.en: They chose a prepaved area to set up the temporary tents.
examples.zh: 他们选择在已铺好的地面上搭建临时帐篷。

definition.en: Simple past / past participle of “prepave”: to pave a road or surface ahead of time.
definition.zh: “prepave”的过去式/过去分词：预先铺路或铺设地面。

examples.en: The city prepaved the shoulder before starting the main roadwork.
examples.zh: 市政府在开始主路施工前，先把路肩预先铺好了。

examples.en: Once the path was prepaved, the workers could move equipment more easily.
examples.zh: 小路预先铺好后，工人搬运设备更方便了。

extraExplanation: “prepaved”在日常英语里不算常见，更常用的说法是“already paved”“pre-paved（加连字符）”或直接用“paved”。在工程、施工、城市规划等语境中更容易见到。

summary.en: Prepavement refers to the stage or work done before paving a road or surface; it’s an uncommon term, often written as pre-pavement.
summary.zh: prepavement 指铺装前的阶段或准备工作；这个词较少见，常写作 pre-pavement。

definition.en: The stage or work done before a road or surface is paved (for example: grading, preparing the base, drainage, and compaction).
definition.zh: 铺路/铺装之前的阶段或准备工作（如整平、基层处理、排水、压实等）。

examples.en: The project is still in the prepavement phase, so the road looks rough and dusty.
examples.zh: 工程还在铺装前阶段，所以路面看起来很粗糙、尘土飞扬。

examples.en: Good prepavement work helps prevent cracks and potholes later.
examples.zh: 良好的铺装前准备能帮助减少后期裂缝和坑洞。

definition.en: Used before a noun to describe something happening before paving.
definition.zh: （作定语）指“铺装前的、铺路前的”。

examples.en: They scheduled a prepavement inspection to check the base layer.
examples.zh: 他们安排了一次铺装前检查来查看基层。

extraExplanation: “prepavement”在一般英语里非常少见，更常见的写法是“pre-pavement”（带连字符）或直接说“pre-paving work / pavement preparation”。如果你是在工程、道路施工文件里看到它，多半是行业用语。
在道路工程语境中，“pre-pavement”通常强调“正式铺沥青/混凝土之前”的关键步骤；这些步骤做不好，后面即使铺得很漂亮，也更容易出现车辙、开裂、坑槽等问题。

summary.en: “Prepaving” means paving a surface ahead of time as preparation, often before the final road surface is installed.
summary.zh: “prepaving”指为后续工程做准备而提前铺设路面/地面，常发生在最终铺装之前。

definition.en: the act or process of paving a road or surface in advance (often as a preliminary or temporary layer before final paving).
definition.zh: （道路/地面）预先铺设、先行铺路（常指在最终铺装前先铺一层临时或基础路面）。

examples.en: The city is prepaving the detour route to handle heavier traffic during construction.
examples.zh: 市政府正在预先铺设绕行路线，以便在施工期间承受更大的车流。

examples.en: Prepaving can reduce dust and improve safety before the final asphalt layer is laid.
examples.zh: 预先铺设可以在铺设最终沥青层之前减少扬尘并提高安全性。

definition.en: present participle of “prepave”: to pave a surface in advance, usually as preparation for later work.
definition.zh: “prepave”的现在分词：为后续工程做准备而提前铺设路面/地面。

examples.en: They are prepaving the site entrance so trucks won’t get stuck in the mud.
examples.zh: 他们正在预先铺设工地入口，这样卡车就不会陷在泥里。

examples.en: The crew spent the morning prepaving the shoulder before resurfacing the highway.
examples.zh: 施工队上午在高速公路重铺之前先预铺了路肩。

extraExplanation: “prepaving”多见于道路与土木工程语境，常与temporary paving（临时铺装）、base course（基层）、subbase（底基层）等概念一起出现。日常英语里不算常用，更常见的说法可能是“pave in advance”或直接说“do preliminary paving”。

summary.en: “Prepay” means to pay in advance, either before receiving something or before a debt is due.
summary.zh: “prepay”表示预付/提前支付，也可指提前还清债务。

definition.en: to pay for something before you receive it or before it is due
definition.zh: 预付；提前支付（在收到商品/服务之前或到期之前付款）

examples.en: You can prepay your phone bill online.
examples.zh: 你可以在网上预付手机账单。

examples.en: Some hotels let you prepay for breakfast when you book the room.
examples.zh: 有些酒店允许你在订房时就预付早餐费用。

definition.en: to pay off a debt earlier than the planned schedule
definition.zh: 提前还清（债务/贷款）

examples.en: If you prepay the loan, you may save money on interest.
examples.zh: 如果你提前还清贷款，可能会省下利息。

examples.en: Check whether there is a prepayment penalty before you prepay your mortgage.
examples.zh: 在提前还房贷之前，先确认是否有提前还款罚金。

extraExplanation: “prepay”由前缀 pre-（在……之前）+ pay 组成，常见于账单、订阅、交通卡、酒店预订等场景。
在金融语境里，prepay 常涉及贷款提前还款；合同里可能出现 prepayment penalty（提前还款罚金）或 prepayment fee（提前还款手续费）。
常见相关词：prepaid（预付的，如 prepaid card 预付卡；prepaid plan 预付费套餐）、prepayment（预付款/提前还款）。

summary.en: Prepayable means something can be paid in advance, especially a loan that can be repaid early.
summary.zh: prepayable 指“可预付/可提前支付的”，尤其常用于“可提前还款的（贷款）”。

definition.en: Able to be paid before it is due (paid in advance).
definition.zh: 可在到期前支付的；可预付的。

examples.en: This loan is prepayable without any penalty.
examples.zh: 这笔贷款可以提前还款，而且不收罚金。

examples.en: Check whether the fee is prepayable or must be paid on the service date.
examples.zh: 确认这笔费用是否可以预付，还是必须在服务当天支付。

definition.en: (Of a loan or debt) allowing the borrower to pay back part or all of it early.
definition.zh: （指贷款或债务）允许借款人提前偿还部分或全部的。

examples.en: The mortgage is prepayable after the first year.
examples.zh: 这笔房贷在第一年后可以提前还。

examples.en: A prepayable contract gives you flexibility if you get extra income.
examples.zh: 可提前偿还的合同在你有额外收入时更灵活。

extraExplanation: “prepayable”常见于金融/合同语境（贷款、抵押贷款、租约、服务费等）。它强调“可以提前付/提前还”，但不一定代表“提前付不会有任何费用”。实际文件里常会搭配：prepayable without penalty（无罚金提前还）、subject to a prepayment fee/penalty（需支付提前还款费用/罚金）。
构词法：pre-（提前）+ pay（支付）+ -able（能够……的）。相关名词是 prepayment（预付款/提前还款）。

summary.en: “Prepaying” means paying in advance, before you receive something or before it is due.
summary.zh: “prepaying”指预先付款/提前支付，在收到商品服务或到期之前先付钱。

definition.en: paying for something before you receive it or before it happens
definition.zh: 预先付款；在收到商品/服务或事情发生之前先付钱

examples.en: Some hotels require prepaying for the first night.
examples.zh: 有些酒店要求预付第一晚的费用。

examples.en: Prepaying your tickets online can save time at the entrance.
examples.zh: 在网上预先买票可以节省入场排队时间。

definition.en: the act of paying in advance; paying before the due date
definition.zh: 预付（行为）；在到期日前提前付款

examples.en: Prepaying is optional, but it may lower your monthly bill.
examples.zh: 预付是可选的，但可能会降低你的月账单。

examples.en: They discussed prepaying part of the loan to reduce interest.
examples.zh: 他们讨论了提前偿还部分贷款以减少利息。

definition.en: present participle of “prepay”: to pay for something in advance
definition.zh: （动词 prepay 的现在分词）预付；提前支付

examples.en: I’m prepaying for the subscription so it won’t renew unexpectedly.
examples.zh: 我先把订阅费预付了，这样就不会意外自动续费。

examples.en: She’s prepaying the deposit to confirm the reservation.
examples.zh: 她在预付定金以确认预订。

extraExplanation: “prepay”= pre-（在……之前）+ pay（付款）。常见于账单、订阅、租房、车费/电话费等场景。
在金融语境里，prepaying a loan 常指“提前还款/部分提前还款”，可能减少利息，但有时会有提前还款手续费（prepayment penalty），需要看合同条款。

summary.en: Prepayment means paying money in advance—either before a service/product is delivered or before a debt is due.
summary.zh: Prepayment 指“预先支付/预付款”，也常指“提前还款”（在到期前支付债务）。

definition.en: money paid before the due date or before receiving a product or service, often as a deposit or advance payment
definition.zh: 预付款；预付费（在到期日前或在收到商品/服务之前支付的钱，常见为订金或预付）

examples.en: The hotel requires a prepayment for the first night.
examples.zh: 酒店要求预付第一晚的费用。

examples.en: We made a 30% prepayment before the work started.
examples.zh: 我们在开工前支付了30%的预付款。

examples.en: Prepayment can lower the total interest on a loan.
examples.zh: 提前还款（预付款）可以减少贷款的总利息。

definition.en: the act of paying money early, especially paying part or all of a debt before it is required
definition.zh: 提前付款；提前还款（指在规定时间前支付部分或全部款项，尤指债务）

examples.en: There is no fee for early prepayment on this mortgage.
examples.zh: 这笔房贷提前还款不收手续费。

examples.en: Prepayment is common when buyers want to secure a limited product.
examples.zh: 当买家想锁定限量商品时，预付款很常见。

extraExplanation: 在金融语境中，prepayment 常指“提前还款”（例如房贷、贷款）。有些合同会写 prepayment penalty（提前还款违约金/罚金），表示提前还款可能要付额外费用。
在购物或服务合同中，prepayment 往往接近 deposit（订金/押金）或 advance payment（预付款）。区别是：deposit 常强调“保留/保证”，可能可退；advance payment 更中性，强调“提前支付”。具体是否可退以合同条款为准。

summary.en: Prepayments are amounts paid in advance, especially in business contracts or accounting (prepaid expenses).
summary.zh: Prepayments 指提前支付的款项，常见于合同中的预付款以及会计中的预付费用（预付项目）。

definition.en: Payments made in advance before the goods, services, or obligations are delivered or due.
definition.zh: 预付款；在商品/服务交付或债务到期之前提前支付的款项。

examples.en: The supplier requires prepayments for large orders.
examples.zh: 供应商对大额订单要求预付款。

examples.en: We collected prepayments to cover the first month’s rent.
examples.zh: 我们收取预付款来覆盖第一个月的房租。

definition.en: (Accounting) An asset category showing money paid ahead of time that will be recorded as an expense later (e.g., prepaid rent, prepaid insurance).
definition.zh: （会计）预付项目/预付费用：先支付、以后再转为费用的资产（如预付房租、预付保险）。

examples.en: Prepayments are recorded as current assets until they are used.
examples.zh: 预付项目在使用前通常记为流动资产。

examples.en: At month-end, we moved part of the prepayments into expenses.
examples.zh: 月末我们把部分预付项目结转为费用。

extraExplanation: “prepayments”是“prepayment”的复数。日常商务里常见于合同条款（如deposit/advance payment），会计里常见于资产科目（prepaid expenses）。
易混词：deposit（押金/订金，常可退或有条件退）；advance payment（预付/提前付款，更强调付款时间）；down payment（首付款，多用于买房买车）。

summary.en: “prepays” means “pays in advance.”
summary.zh: “prepays”意思是“预先付款/预付”。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “prepay”) to pay for something before you receive it or before it is due.
definition.zh: （“prepay”的第三人称单数）在收到商品/服务之前或到期之前预先付款。

examples.en: She prepays for her online orders to avoid cash on delivery.
examples.zh: 她网购时会预先付款，以避免货到付款。

examples.en: The company prepays the rent for six months.
examples.zh: 公司预付了六个月的房租。

extraExplanation: “prepays”是动词“prepay”的第三人称单数形式，主语通常是he/she/it或单数名词（如“The customer prepays…”）。
常见相关词：prepaid（形容词，已预付的）/ prepayment（名词，预付款）。口语里也常说 pay in advance 或 pay upfront。

summary.en: “prepd” is an informal short spelling meaning “prepared/ready,” or the past form of “prep” (prepare).
summary.zh: “prepd”是非正式缩写，表示“prepared（准备好）”，也可指“prep（准备）”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (informal) Prepared; ready for something.
definition.zh: （非正式）准备好的；有准备的。

examples.en: Are you prepd for the interview tomorrow?
examples.zh: 你为明天的面试准备好了吗？

examples.en: I wasn’t prepd for how cold it would be.
examples.zh: 我没准备好会这么冷。

definition.en: (informal spelling) Past tense/past participle of “prep,” meaning to prepare (often used in cooking, schoolwork, or training).
definition.zh: （非正式拼写）“prep”的过去式/过去分词，意为“准备”（常用于做饭备料、学习或训练）。

examples.en: I prepd the vegetables before dinner.
examples.zh: 我在晚饭前把蔬菜都备好了。

examples.en: She prepd her notes the night before the presentation.
examples.zh: 她在演讲前一晚准备了笔记。

extraExplanation: “prepd”常见于短信、聊天或课堂笔记里，是“prepped / prepared”的省略写法；正式写作中建议用“prepared”或“prepped”。
“prep”本身就是“prepare”的口语缩短形式；在美式英语里也常见于“meal prep（备餐）”“prep school（预科学校）”等搭配。

summary.en: Prepectoral means “in front of the pectoral (chest) muscles,” commonly used in medical contexts like implant placement.
summary.zh: Prepectoral 指“在胸肌前方的”，常用于植入物放置等医学语境。

definition.en: (Anatomy/medicine) Located in front of the pectoral muscle(s) or the chest wall; anterior to the pectoralis major.
definition.zh: （解剖/医学）位于胸肌（尤其是胸大肌）前方的；在胸肌之前的。

examples.en: The surgeon created a prepectoral pocket to place the implant.
examples.zh: 外科医生在胸肌前建立了一个腔隙来放置植入物。

examples.en: Prepectoral reconstruction may reduce animation deformity compared with subpectoral placement.
examples.zh: 与胸肌下放置相比，胸肌前（prepectoral）重建可能减少“运动变形”。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前/前方”， “pectoral”与胸部/胸肌有关（来自拉丁语 pectus“胸”）。因此 prepectoral 直译就是“胸肌前的”。
该词常见于乳房重建或隆胸相关语境，用来对比 subpectoral（胸肌下）放置方式；属于专业医学用语，日常英语里不常用。

summary.en: A biology term for the part just before/below a peduncle (main flower or fruit stalk).
summary.zh: 生物学术语：指花梗/果梗之前或下方的梗状基部部分。

definition.en: (Biology, botany) A stalk-like part located before or below the peduncle (the main flower/fruit stalk), sometimes treated as the basal section leading into the peduncle.
definition.zh: （生物/植物）位于花梗/果梗（peduncle，主要花序或果实的柄）之前或下方的“前梗/基部梗状部分”，可理解为连接到花梗的基部段。

examples.en: The botanist measured the prepeduncle and the peduncle separately to describe the plant’s structure.
examples.zh: 植物学家把前梗（prepeduncle）和花梗（peduncle）分开测量，以描述植物的结构。

examples.en: Damage to the prepeduncle can weaken the support for the flower stalk.
examples.zh: 前梗受损会削弱对花梗的支撑。

extraExplanation: 词源上由前缀 pre-（在……之前）+ peduncle（花梗/果梗）构成，因此多用于形态学描述，表示“花梗之前的那一段/基部段”。
这是相对少见、偏专业的术语，具体边界在不同类群或不同作者的描述中可能不完全一致；写作时常需要配合图示或上下文说明。

summary.en: “Prepend” means to add something to the beginning (the front) of something else.
summary.zh: “prepend”指把某物加到另一物的开头（前面）。

definition.en: to add something to the beginning of a word, sentence, list, or document
definition.zh: 在（词、句子、列表或文件）的开头添加某物（前置、加在前面）

examples.en: Please prepend “Re:” to the subject line.
examples.zh: 请在邮件主题前加上“Re:”。

examples.en: The editor prepended a short introduction to the article.
examples.zh: 编辑在文章开头加了一段简短的引言。

definition.en: (computing) to add an item to the front of a string, array, or list
definition.zh: （计算机）把元素添加到字符串、数组或列表的开头

examples.en: We prepend a country code to the phone number before saving it.
examples.zh: 保存前我们会在电话号码前加上国家代码。

examples.en: In many languages, you can prepend an element to the list efficiently.
examples.zh: 在很多编程语言中，把元素加到列表开头通常很高效。

extraExplanation: “prepend”由 pre-（在前）+ append（附加）构成，意思正好和“append（追加到末尾）”相对。
在写作/编辑中常见搭配：prepend A to B（把A加到B的前面）。注意不要把“prepend to”写反：应说“prepend a prefix to a word”。

summary.en: “Prepended” means something was added to the beginning of something else.
summary.zh: “Prepended”表示把某物加到另一事物的开头（前面）。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of “prepend”) to add something to the beginning of a text, list, message, or sequence.
definition.zh: （动词 prepend 的过去式/过去分词）把某物添加到文本、列表、消息或序列的开头。

examples.en: The system prepended a timestamp to every log line.
examples.zh: 系统在每条日志行前面加上了时间戳。

examples.en: She prepended “Re:” to the subject line before replying.
examples.zh: 她回复前在邮件主题前加上了“Re:”。

definition.en: Placed or added at the beginning (used as an adjective, often in technical writing).
definition.zh: 放在开头的；被加在前面的（常作形容词，多见于技术语境）。

examples.en: Use the prepended prefix to identify test accounts.
examples.zh: 用加在前面的前缀来识别测试账号。

examples.en: A prepended warning message appears before the main content.
examples.zh: 主内容前会出现一段加在前面的警告信息。

extraExplanation: 在计算机与写作语境中，prepend 常与 append（追加到末尾）对比：prepend = 加到开头，append = 加到结尾。
常见搭配：prepend a prefix / prepend a header / prepend a timestamp（在前面加前缀/头部/时间戳）。

summary.en: Prepending means adding something to the beginning of something else, especially in writing or computing.
summary.zh: prepending 指把某物添加到另一物的开头，常用于写作或编程语境。

definition.en: Adding something to the beginning of something else (for example, adding a word, prefix, or piece of data at the start).
definition.zh: 把某物加在另一物的开头（例如在开头加一个词、前缀或一段数据）。

examples.en: Try prepending “Mr.” to his last name.
examples.zh: 试着在他的姓前面加上“Mr.”。

examples.en: The system is prepending a timestamp to every message.
examples.zh: 系统正在给每条消息前面加上时间戳。

definition.en: (Computing) Placing data at the start of a string, file, list, or command.
definition.zh: （计算机）把数据放到字符串、文件、列表或命令的最前面。

examples.en: By prepending “https://”, the link becomes valid.
examples.zh: 在前面加上“https://”后，这个链接就有效了。

examples.en: The script is prepending new log entries to the file.
examples.zh: 脚本正在把新的日志条目加到文件开头。

extraExplanation: “prepending”是动词“prepend”的现在分词/动名词形式；常见搭配：prepend A to B（把A加到B前面）。
在编程语境里，prepend常与append（追加到末尾）对比：prepend = 加到前面；append = 加到后面。

summary.en: A very rare, nonstandard form meaning “to penetrate beforehand.” Usually rephrased in natural English.
summary.zh: 非常少见、非标准的说法，大意为“提前穿透/渗入”；通常建议改成更自然的表达。

definition.en: (Not standard in modern English) To penetrate something beforehand or in advance; used very rarely, usually in technical or improvised writing.
definition.zh: （现代英语中不标准）在……之前先穿透/渗入；非常少见，多见于技术语境或临时造词。

examples.en: This term is rare; most writers would say “penetrate beforehand” instead of “prepenetrate.”
examples.zh: 这个词很少见；大多数写作者会用“penetrate beforehand”而不是“prepenetrate”。

examples.en: The report suggests the chemical may penetrate the tissue early (rather than “prepenetrate” it).
examples.zh: 报告指出这种化学物质可能会较早渗入组织（而不是用“prepenetrate”这种说法）。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是表示“在……之前”的前缀（如 preheat 预热、prepay 预付），“penetrate”是“穿透/渗入”。把两者硬拼成 prepenetrate 在英语里不常见，所以读者可能觉得别扭或不自然。
更自然的表达通常是：penetrate beforehand / penetrate in advance / already penetrate / early penetration。若想表达“先发制人/抢先行动”，常用 preempt。
