summary.en: Preprogram means to arrange or program something in advance so it happens automatically or as planned later.
summary.zh: preprogram 指“预先安排/预先编程”，让事情或设备之后自动按计划运行。

definition.en: to set up in advance; to plan or arrange what will happen before it happens (often by writing instructions or a schedule)
definition.zh: 预先设定；预先安排（常指提前写好指令或日程，使之后按计划进行）

examples.en: The museum visit was preprogrammed, so everyone knew where to go and when.
examples.zh: 博物馆参观是预先安排好的，所以大家都知道什么时候去哪里。

examples.en: You can preprogram the robot to stop if it detects an obstacle.
examples.zh: 你可以预先设定机器人在检测到障碍物时停止。

definition.en: to write a program in advance for a device or system; to load or configure software instructions beforehand
definition.zh: （给设备/系统）预先编程；提前写入或配置软件指令

examples.en: The technician preprogrammed the remote control to work with the TV.
examples.zh: 技术员把遥控器预先编程，使它能控制电视。

examples.en: We preprogrammed the lights to turn on at 6 p.m.
examples.zh: 我们把灯预先设定为下午6点自动打开。

extraExplanation: 在英语里也常写作 pre-program 或 preprogram（美式更常见合写）。作为动词，它既可以指“提前安排流程”（更一般），也可以更具体地指“提前写入程序/指令”（更偏技术）。
相关词：program（编程/安排）、preprogrammed（预先设定的，形容词用法）。近义表达：set up in advance, preset, schedule ahead of time。

summary.en: Preprogrammed means set up in advance to follow a planned program; it can also mean having been programmed beforehand.
summary.zh: preprogrammed 指“预先设定好的；预先编程过的”，用于描述设备按既定程序运行，也可指“已被提前设定指令”。

definition.en: Planned or set in advance, especially in a machine, device, or system so it will act in a fixed way.
definition.zh: （尤指机器、设备或系统）预先设定好的；按预先程序运行的。

examples.en: The robot has a preprogrammed routine for cleaning the floor.
examples.zh: 这个机器人有一套预先设定的清洁地面程序。

examples.en: The thermostat follows a preprogrammed schedule to save energy.
examples.zh: 恒温器按预先设定的时间表运行以节省能源。

definition.en: To set instructions in advance for a device, computer, or system to follow.
definition.zh: 预先编程；预先设定（设备、计算机或系统要执行的指令）。

examples.en: The engineer preprogrammed the drone to return home if the battery gets low.
examples.zh: 工程师预先设定了无人机在电量低时自动返航。

examples.en: You can preprogram the coffee maker so it starts at 7 a.m.
examples.zh: 你可以预先设定咖啡机，让它在早上7点开始工作。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，所以 preprogrammed 字面意思是“在运行前就把程序设好”。常见拼写有 preprogrammed 和 pre-programmed（加连字符更强调“预先设定”）。在英式拼写中也可能看到 preprogramme / preprogrammed 的变体。
这个词在科技语境最常见；在日常谈话中也可比喻人“像被设定好一样”行动（常带轻微批评意味，如缺乏灵活性）。

summary.en: Pre-Prohibition means “before the U.S. Prohibition era (1920–1933).”
summary.zh: pre-Prohibition 指“美国禁酒令时期（1920–1933）之前的”。

definition.en: Happening in the time before Prohibition (the U.S. nationwide ban on making and selling alcohol, 1920–1933).
definition.zh: 发生在“禁酒令时期”（美国全国性禁酒，1920–1933）之前的；禁酒令之前的。

examples.en: The novel is set in pre-Prohibition New York, when saloons were still legal.
examples.zh: 这部小说以禁酒令之前的纽约为背景，当时酒馆仍是合法的。

examples.en: Pre-Prohibition cocktails often used stronger spirits and simple ingredients.
examples.zh: 禁酒令之前的鸡尾酒常用烈度更高的烈酒和更简单的配料。

definition.en: Relating to the culture, businesses, or lifestyle of the period before Prohibition.
definition.zh: 与禁酒令之前的文化、行业或生活方式相关的。

examples.en: They restored the building as a pre-Prohibition bar with period-style decor.
examples.zh: 他们把这栋建筑修复成一间禁酒令之前风格的酒吧，装饰也很复古。

examples.en: The museum has a small exhibit on pre-Prohibition brewing in the Midwest.
examples.zh: 博物馆有一个小展览，介绍中西部禁酒令之前的酿酒业。

extraExplanation: “Prohibition”在美国语境里通常特指第18修正案及《沃尔斯泰德法》（Volstead Act）实施后的全国禁酒（1920–1933）。因此“pre-Prohibition”常用于历史、文学与餐饮文化（如鸡尾酒、酒吧、酿酒业）讨论中。
写法上更常见的是带连字符的“pre-Prohibition”。不带连字符的“preprohibition”较少见，但意思相同。

summary.en: “Prepromise” means to promise something in advance (or such an advance promise), often implying the promise is made too early.
summary.zh: “prepromise”指“预先承诺”（或这种承诺本身），常带有“承诺得太早”的含义。

definition.en: to promise something in advance, often before all details are known
definition.zh: 预先承诺（在细节尚未完全确定前就先答应）

examples.en: The manager refused to prepromise a bonus before seeing the year-end results.
examples.zh: 经理拒绝在看到年终业绩前就预先承诺发奖金。

examples.en: Don’t prepromise delivery dates if the supply chain is unstable.
examples.zh: 如果供应链不稳定，就不要预先承诺交付日期。

definition.en: an advance promise made before all information is available
definition.zh: 预先承诺（提前给出的承诺）

examples.en: His prepromise created expectations the team couldn’t meet.
examples.zh: 他的预先承诺造成了团队无法满足的期待。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是常见前缀，表示“在……之前”。“prepromise”不是最常见的标准用词，写作和职场语境里有时会用来强调“过早承诺”的风险。更常见、更自然的说法包括：promise in advance / make an advance promise / commit too early（过早承诺）。

summary.en: Prepromised means promised in advance; already committed before something else happens.
summary.zh: prepromised 表示“预先承诺的；事先已经答应/已经分配好的”。

definition.en: promised in advance; already pledged before a later time or event.
definition.zh: 预先承诺的；事先答应的。

examples.en: The funds were prepromised to other projects, so we couldn’t use them.
examples.zh: 这笔资金已经预先承诺给其他项目了，所以我们不能使用。

examples.en: She couldn’t accept the invitation because her weekend was prepromised to family plans.
examples.zh: 她不能接受邀请，因为她的周末已经事先答应要陪家人。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “prepromise”: to promise or pledge ahead of time.
definition.zh: “prepromise”的过去式/过去分词：提前承诺；预先保证。

examples.en: They prepromised support before the vote even began.
examples.zh: 投票还没开始，他们就提前承诺支持了。

examples.en: I had prepromised to help, so I stayed late at the office.
examples.zh: 我之前已经答应帮忙，所以我在办公室加班到很晚。

extraExplanation: “prepromised / prepromise”在日常英语里不算常见，更常用的说法是“already promised”“promised in advance”“committed beforehand”。
它常出现在合同、资金分配、日程安排等语境里，强调“在之后的决定/请求出现之前就已经承诺给别处”，带有“不可再挪用/无法再答应别人”的含义。

summary.en: “Prepromising” means promising something too early (often more than you can guarantee).
summary.zh: “prepromising”指过早做出承诺（常带过度承诺、难以保证之意）。

definition.en: making promises in advance; often suggesting someone promises too much before knowing what they can truly deliver
definition.zh: 提前做出承诺；常含“在还未确定能做到前就过度承诺”的意味

examples.en: The manager’s prepromising created unrealistic expectations for the launch date.
examples.zh: 经理的提前承诺让大家对发布日期产生了不切实际的期待。

examples.en: Try not to be prepromising—confirm the details first, then commit.
examples.zh: 尽量别提前承诺——先确认细节，再做决定。

extraExplanation: “prepromising”并不是非常常见的标准词，更多时候人们会说：make promises too early / overpromise / promise ahead of time。
构词上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ promise（承诺）+ -ing（形容词/现在分词），强调“承诺发生得太早”。在商务沟通或项目管理语境里，这个词常带轻微批评：承诺先行、条件未定，容易导致落差与信任受损。

summary.en: “Prepromote” means to promote something ahead of time (and less commonly, to promote someone earlier than planned).
summary.zh: “prepromote”指“提前推广/预热”，较少见时也可指“提前晋升”。

definition.en: to promote something in advance; to build interest or awareness before the official launch, release, or event
definition.zh: 预先宣传；在正式发布/上线/活动开始前提前推广、造势

examples.en: The studio prepromoted the film with short teaser videos months before the release.
examples.zh: 电影公司在上映前几个月就用短预告片为这部电影预先造势。

examples.en: We should prepromote the webinar so people have time to register.
examples.zh: 我们应该提前宣传这场线上讲座，让大家有时间报名。

definition.en: to move someone to a higher role or status earlier than planned (less common; often used in workplace or system/process contexts)
definition.zh: （较少见）提前晋升；比原计划更早提升某人的职位/权限/等级

examples.en: The manager prepromoted her to team lead to cover the project gap.
examples.zh: 经理为了填补项目空缺，提前把她晋升为组长。

examples.en: Accounts that meet the criteria may be prepromoted to the next access level.
examples.zh: 符合条件的账号可能会被提前提升到更高的访问权限级别。

extraExplanation: “prepromote”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ promote（“推广/晋升”）构成，意思通常很直观：把“推广或晋升”这件事提前做。
它不是特别常见的日常词，更常见的表达是：promote in advance / do pre-release promotion / build buzz early（提前造势）。在营销、影视、活动策划、产品发布等语境里会更自然。

summary.en: Prepromoted means promoted earlier than expected or before an official change.
summary.zh: prepromoted 指“比预期更早、在正式变动前就被提前晋升/提拔”。

definition.en: Promoted in advance (before a usual time, event, or public announcement).
definition.zh: 提前晋升的；预先提拔的（在通常时间、事件或公开宣布之前）。

examples.en: Some employees were prepromoted to team lead roles before the new project officially started.
examples.zh: 有些员工在新项目正式开始前就被提前提拔为组长。

examples.en: The company quietly prepromoted a few managers so they could make decisions immediately after the merger.
examples.zh: 公司悄悄提前提拔了几位经理，以便在并购后立刻能做决策。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是常见前缀，表示“在……之前、预先”。所以 prepromoted 常用于职场或组织语境，强调“提前（被）升职/提拔”的时间点。
prepromoted 在日常口语中不算特别常见，更常见的表达是 “promoted early / promoted ahead of schedule / promoted in advance”。

summary.en: “Prepromoting” means promoting something ahead of its official launch or main release.
summary.zh: “prepromoting”指在正式发布或主要活动开始前进行提前宣传/预热推广。

definition.en: promoting something in advance, before the main launch or official release (often used in marketing, events, or campaigns).
definition.zh: 提前宣传；在正式发布/上线之前进行推广（常用于营销、活动或宣传项目）。

examples.en: They are prepromoting the new album with short teaser videos.
examples.zh: 他们用一些短预告视频来提前宣传这张新专辑。

examples.en: Prepromoting the event helps people save the date.
examples.zh: 提前宣传活动可以让大家先把日期空出来。

examples.en: We started prepromoting the app two weeks before launch.
examples.zh: 我们在应用正式上线前两周就开始提前推广了。

definition.en: the act of promoting something in advance; advertising or building interest ahead of time.
definition.zh: 提前推广；预热宣传（在正式开始前先吸引关注）。

examples.en: Prepromoting can increase turnout for a concert.
examples.zh: 提前推广能提高演唱会的到场人数。

examples.en: Most of the prepromoting happened on social media.
examples.zh: 大部分预热宣传都在社交媒体上进行。

definition.en: present participle of “prepromote”: to promote something in advance.
definition.zh: “prepromote”的现在分词：提前推广；预先宣传。

examples.en: We’re prepromoting the sale to loyal customers first.
examples.zh: 我们先向老客户预先宣传这次促销。

extraExplanation: “prepromote / prepromoting”不是最常见的标准词汇，更常见的表达有：pre-launch promotion（发布前推广）、tease / teaser campaign（预告/预热宣传）、build buzz（制造话题热度）、promote in advance（提前宣传）。
在职场或营销语境里，“prepromoting”通常暗含“为正式发布做铺垫”：先让目标受众知道、产生期待、愿意预约/报名/关注。

summary.en: Prepromotion means preparation or marketing done before the main promotion, or (less commonly) the stage before a job promotion.
summary.zh: prepromotion 指在正式促销/推广之前的预热与准备；较少用时也可指升职前阶段。

definition.en: activities or efforts done before a promotion (such as marketing, advertising, or announcements) to prepare people for it
definition.zh: （在正式促销/推广/晋升之前进行的）预热活动；预先推广；预宣传

examples.en: The company planned a two-week prepromotion campaign before the product launch.
examples.zh: 公司在产品发布前安排了为期两周的预热宣传活动。

examples.en: Good prepromotion can build interest and make the main promotion more effective.
examples.zh: 好的预先推广能提升关注度，让正式促销更有效。

definition.en: the period or stage before someone is promoted to a higher position (less common)
definition.zh: （较少用）晋升前阶段；升职前的准备期

examples.en: During her prepromotion year, she took leadership training and led a small project.
examples.zh: 在她晋升前的一年里，她参加了领导力培训并带领了一个小项目。

extraExplanation: “prepromotion”不是非常常见的标准词，更多出现在市场营销或人力资源语境中，表示“在主要促销/推广/晋升之前的准备与预热”。更常见的表达包括：pre-promotion, pre-launch promotion, teaser campaign（预告式宣传）。
写作中如果担心读者不熟悉，可以改用更透明的说法：“pre-launch marketing”或“promotion in advance”。

summary.en: “Prepronounce” means to practice saying a word/name beforehand.
summary.zh: “prepronounce”指在开口前先练习某个词/名字的发音。

definition.en: To pronounce (a word or name) in advance, especially by rehearsing how it should sound before speaking aloud.
definition.zh: （在说出口之前）预先发音、提前练习某个词或名字的读法。

examples.en: Before the meeting, I prepronounced the client’s name so I wouldn’t say it wrong.
examples.zh: 开会前，我先把客户的名字预先练习了一遍，免得念错。

examples.en: If you’re nervous, prepronounce the key terms quietly to build confidence.
examples.zh: 如果你紧张，可以先小声预先读一遍关键术语来增加自信。

extraExplanation: “prepronounce”不是常见的标准词汇，更常见的表达是“practice pronouncing… / rehearse the pronunciation of… / say it to yourself first”。在正式写作中建议用这些更自然的说法。
构词上是“pre-（预先）+ pronounce（发音）”，因此读者一般能猜到意思，但在口语或文章里使用时可能显得生造或不够地道。

summary.en: Prepronounced means already said/pronounced earlier or pronounced in advance, sometimes with the pronunciation fixed beforehand.
summary.zh: prepronounced 指“事先已经念过/说过的”或“预先发音的”，也可指“发音已预先确定的”。

definition.en: Already pronounced earlier; said in advance (often so it can be repeated, quoted, or used as a model).
definition.zh: 事先已经念过/说过的；预先发音（常用于让别人复述、引用或作为示范）。

examples.en: The teacher played a prepronounced recording so students could repeat the sounds.
examples.zh: 老师播放了一段预先录好的发音，让学生跟读。

examples.en: She used prepronounced phrases to practice the dialogue.
examples.zh: 她用事先念好的短语来练习对话。

definition.en: Having a pronunciation decided or fixed beforehand (so it is not chosen spontaneously).
definition.zh: 发音已预先确定的（不是临时随口决定的）。

examples.en: In the audiobook, the character names are prepronounced to keep them consistent.
examples.zh: 在有声书里，人名的发音事先定好，以保持一致。

extraExplanation: 这个词并不常见，更常见的表达是："pre-recorded pronunciation"（预录发音）、"already pronounced"（已经发过音）、"pronounced in advance"（预先发音）。
写法上常见带连字符的形式 "pre-pronounced"，尤其在编辑或技术语境中用来强调“pre-（预先）+ pronounced（发过音的）”。

summary.en: A prepronouncement is an advance, often official-sounding statement made before the final decision or outcome.
summary.zh: prepronouncement 指在最终决定或结果出来之前作出的（常带正式/权威语气的）预先声明或预断。

definition.en: A statement, announcement, or judgment made in advance (before the final decision or event).
definition.zh: 预先发表的声明／宣布／判断（在最终决定或事情发生之前说出的表态）。

examples.en: The committee avoided any prepronouncement until all the evidence was reviewed.
examples.zh: 委员会在审阅完所有证据之前，避免作出任何预先表态。

examples.en: In a trial, a judge must not make a prepronouncement about the verdict.
examples.zh: 在审判中，法官不应对裁决作出预先判断。

extraExplanation: “prepronouncement”并不是常见的标准词汇，更常见的表达是“premature statement / advance announcement / early pronouncement / prejudgment（预断）”。它由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ pronouncement（正式声明/裁断）构成，意思容易理解，但在正式写作中建议用更常见的替代表达。
“pronouncement”常带有“正式、权威”的语气（如法官、政府、机构的声明）。因此“prepronouncement”往往暗示“过早的、可能带偏见的表态”，在法律或公共议题语境里更常见。

summary.en: “Prepronouncing” means pronouncing something in advance, usually for practice.
summary.zh: “prepronouncing”指预先发音，通常用于练习。

definition.en: (present participle) pronouncing a word or sound in advance, especially to rehearse or plan how it will be said.
definition.zh: （现在分词）预先发音；在说出之前先练习或先决定某个词/声音怎么读。

examples.en: Before the speech, she was prepronouncing difficult names to avoid mistakes.
examples.zh: 演讲前，她在预先练习一些难读的人名，以免出错。

examples.en: The actor spent time prepronouncing the unfamiliar words in the script.
examples.zh: 这位演员花时间预先练习剧本里不熟悉的单词发音。

definition.en: (less common) saying something ahead of time in a way that emphasizes how it should sound.
definition.zh: （较少见）提前说出（某句话/词），强调它应该怎么发音或呈现出来。

examples.en: The teacher was prepronouncing the sentence so students could repeat it clearly.
examples.zh: 老师先把句子读一遍，让学生能更清楚地跟读。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是常见前缀，表示“在……之前/预先”。“prepronounce”并不是特别常用的标准词，更常见的表达是“practice pronouncing”“rehearse pronunciation”或“say it beforehand”。在正式写作中，通常用这些更自然的说法。

summary.en: Preprophetic describes something from before the era of the prophets, especially in religious or historical contexts.
summary.zh: preprophetic 指“先知时代之前的”，多用于宗教或历史语境。

definition.en: (especially in religious or historical writing) happening before the time of the prophets, or belonging to an early period before prophetic messages and writings became central.
definition.zh: （尤用于宗教/历史语境）发生在先知时代之前的；属于预言传统尚未成为核心之前早期时期的。

examples.en: Some scholars describe the poem’s themes as preprophetic, coming from an older tradition of worship.
examples.zh: 一些学者把这首诗的主题称为“前先知时期”的，认为它来自更古老的崇拜传统。

examples.en: The author contrasts preprophetic practices with later prophetic calls for justice.
examples.zh: 作者把前先知时期的做法与后来先知对公义的呼吁作对比。

extraExplanation: 这个词多见于圣经研究、古代近东历史或宗教学术写作中，常用来区分“早期传统/制度”（如祭祀、王权、律法形成期）与“先知传统”兴起之后的思想与文本。
“pre-”表示“在……之前”。“prophetic”在这里通常不是指日常英语里“有预见性的”，而是指与（圣经意义上的）先知及其信息相关。

summary.en: Preprostatic means “in front of the prostate,” mainly used in medical anatomy.
summary.zh: preprostatic 指“位于前列腺前方的”，主要用于医学解剖语境。

definition.en: Located in front of the prostate gland; relating to the area anterior to the prostate (often used in medical/anatomical contexts).
definition.zh: 位于前列腺前方的；与前列腺前方区域有关的（常用于医学/解剖学语境）。

examples.en: The MRI report noted a small preprostatic mass.
examples.zh: 核磁共振报告提到前列腺前方有一个小肿块。

examples.en: Pain was described in the preprostatic region.
examples.zh: 疼痛被描述为位于前列腺前方区域。

extraExplanation: 词缀拆解：pre- 表示“在……之前/前方”，prostatic 来自 prostate（前列腺）+ -ic（“与……有关的”）。因此 preprostatic 直译为“前列腺前方的/与前列腺前方有关的”。
这是较专业的医学形容词，常见于影像报告、解剖描述或手术记录中；日常交流更常说 “in front of the prostate / anterior to the prostate”。

summary.en: Preprove is an archaic verb meaning to prove or test something in advance.
summary.zh: preprove 是一个古用动词，表示“预先证明/预先检验”。

definition.en: (Archaic) to prove or test something beforehand; to verify in advance.
definition.zh: （古用）预先证明或预先检验；事先核实。

examples.en: The scholar tried to preprove the claim with earlier records before presenting it.
examples.zh: 这位学者在提出观点前，先用早期记录来预先证明它。

examples.en: In older writing, a character may preprove a plan by small trials first.
examples.zh: 在较早的文学作品里，人物可能会先用小规模试验来预先验证计划。

definition.en: (Archaic) to show someone’s innocence or honesty in advance; to clear beforehand.
definition.zh: （古用）预先证明某人清白或诚实；事先澄清。

examples.en: He wrote letters to preprove his loyalty before the accusations spread.
examples.zh: 在指控扩散前，他写信来预先证明自己的忠诚。

extraExplanation: “preprove”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ prove（“证明/检验”）构成，但它在现代英语中非常少见，多见于较早期的文学或历史文本。
现代英语更常用的表达是 “prove beforehand / verify in advance / test in advance”。在写作中使用“preprove”会带有明显的古风、书面和文学色彩。

summary.en: “Preproved” is a nonstandard form usually meaning “preapproved” (approved in advance).
summary.zh: “preproved”是非标准写法，通常意为“preapproved”（预先批准的）。

definition.en: (Nonstandard; usually written as **preapproved**) approved in advance, before the final event or request happens.
definition.zh: （非标准写法；通常写作 **preapproved**）预先批准的；事先核准的。

examples.en: Your credit limit is **preapproved**, but the bank will still verify your information.
examples.zh: 你的信用额度已被**预先批准**，但银行仍会核实你的信息。

examples.en: Only **preapproved** vendors can enter the building.
examples.zh: 只有**事先核准**的供应商才能进入大楼。

extraExplanation: “preproved”在现代英语中非常少见，实际使用里多半是把 **preapproved**（预先批准的）拼错了。正式写作、邮件、合同或申请材料中建议用 **preapproved**。
常见搭配：preapproved loan（预批贷款）、preapproved card（预批信用卡）、preapproved list（预先核准名单）。

summary.en: “Preprovide” means to provide something ahead of time.
summary.zh: “preprovide” 指提前把某物提供好。

definition.en: to provide something in advance; to supply beforehand (often so it will be ready when needed).
definition.zh: 预先提供；事先供应（通常为了在需要时已准备好）。

examples.en: The school will preprovide tablets for students who don’t have devices at home.
examples.zh: 学校将为家里没有设备的学生预先提供平板电脑。

examples.en: Please preprovide the documents so we can review them before the meeting.
examples.zh: 请提前提供文件，这样我们可以在会议前审阅。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是英语中常见的前缀，表示“在……之前/预先”。因此 *preprovide* 字面意思就是“先提供”。在日常英语里，这个词比较少见，通常更常用 *provide in advance*, *provide beforehand*, *pre-supply* 或 *prearrange*（视语境而定）。

summary.en: Preprovided means supplied ahead of time.
summary.zh: preprovided 指“提前供应/预先提供”。

definition.en: given or supplied in advance (before it is needed), often by an organization or system
definition.zh: 预先提供的；事先给出的（通常由机构或系统提前准备好）

examples.en: The hotel room had preprovided toiletries, so we didn’t need to buy any.
examples.zh: 酒店房间里预先提供了洗漱用品，所以我们不用再买。

examples.en: Please use the preprovided template to write your report.
examples.zh: 请使用事先提供的模板来写报告。

examples.en: All participants received preprovided login details by email.
examples.zh: 所有参与者都通过邮件收到了预先提供的登录信息。

extraExplanation: “preprovided”多见于较正式或技术/行政语境（如表格说明、合同条款、软件文档），意思接近“already provided”。日常口语里更常说“already provided / provided in advance”。

summary.en: Preproviding means providing something ahead of time.
summary.zh: preproviding 指“提前/预先提供”。

definition.en: providing something in advance (before it is needed or officially requested).
definition.zh: 预先提供（在需要或正式要求之前先给出某物）。

examples.en: The school is preproviding laptops so students can start online learning immediately.
examples.zh: 学校预先提供笔记本电脑，让学生可以立刻开始线上学习。

examples.en: Preproviding key documents can speed up the visa process.
examples.zh: 预先提供关键文件可以加快签证办理流程。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是表示“在……之前”的前缀（如 preview 预览、prepay 预付）。因此 preproviding 通常可理解为“提前提供”。但这个词在日常英语里不算常见，写作中更常用 providing in advance / providing ahead of time。
如果你是在正式文件或技术场景（如物流、系统权限、资源配置）看到它，通常强调“提前配置/提前发放资源”，以免之后延误。

summary.en: To pre-set up or allocate resources/configuration in advance, especially in IT or telecom.
summary.zh: （多用于 IT/电信）提前配置或预分配资源与设置。

definition.en: (IT/telecom) To set up or allocate resources, permissions, or configuration in advance so a user, device, or service will work immediately when activated.
definition.zh: （IT/电信）预先配置或分配资源、权限或设置，使用户/设备/服务在启用时可立即使用。

examples.en: The IT team preprovisioned laptops with the required security software before the new employees arrived.
examples.zh: IT 团队在新员工到来前，就把笔记本电脑预先配置好所需的安全软件。

examples.en: We preprovision phone numbers and SIM profiles so customers can activate service in minutes.
examples.zh: 我们会预先配置电话号码和 SIM 配置文件，让客户几分钟内就能开通服务。

examples.en: The cloud system can preprovision storage to avoid delays during peak traffic.
examples.zh: 云系统可以预先分配存储空间，避免高峰流量时出现延迟。

extraExplanation: “preprovision”在日常英语里不常见，更常写作带连字符的“pre-provision”。它多见于企业 IT、云计算、移动通信等场景，强调“提前把配置/资源准备好”，以减少上线或开通时的等待。

summary.en: a prior or earlier provocation
summary.zh: 事先（先前）的挑衅

definition.en: (Rare) A provocation that happens beforehand; earlier words or actions that may have triggered a later reaction or conflict.
definition.zh: （罕见）事先的挑衅；在某个反应或冲突发生之前的言语或行为，可能引发后续事件。

examples.en: The defense argued that there was preprovocation, so the response was not completely unprovoked.
examples.zh: 辩方主张存在事先挑衅，因此对方的反应并非完全无缘无故。

examples.en: Without clear evidence of preprovocation, the incident looked like a sudden outburst.
examples.zh: 在没有明确事先挑衅证据的情况下，这起事件看起来像是突然爆发。

extraExplanation: “preprovocation”不是常见词，更常见的写法是“prior provocation”或“previous provocation”，有时也会写成带连字符的“pre-provocation”。
多用于法律或争议叙述中，用来强调“先前是否有人挑衅”这一点，以影响对责任、动机或反应是否“无端”的判断。

summary.en: “Preprovoke” means to provoke someone in advance, but it is rare and nonstandard in English.
summary.zh: “preprovoke”意为“提前挑衅/激怒”，但在英语中很少见且不算标准用法。

definition.en: (Rare, nonstandard) To provoke or stir up (someone or something) in advance; to trigger a reaction before something else happens.
definition.zh: （罕见、非标准用法）事先挑衅/激怒（某人）；提前引发（某种反应）。

examples.en: The headline was written to preprovoke outrage before readers saw the full story.
examples.zh: 这个标题的写法是为了在读者看到全文之前就先激起愤怒。

examples.en: Try not to preprovoke your teammates with jokes right before the meeting.
examples.zh: 开会前尽量不要用玩笑提前惹恼队友。

extraExplanation: “preprovoke”并不是常见或标准的英语词，通常更自然的表达是：provoke in advance（提前挑衅/激起）、provoke beforehand（事先激怒）、deliberately provoke early（刻意提前挑起）。
构词逻辑是前缀 pre-（在……之前）+ provoke（挑衅/激怒）。因为 provoke 本身就常含“引发/激起”的意思，所以再加 pre- 在语感上会显得累赘，因此在正式写作中不常用。

summary.en: Preprovoked means already provoked beforehand—upset or triggered in advance.
summary.zh: preprovoked 指“事先就被激怒/被触发”，即在发生某事之前情绪或反应就已被挑起。

definition.en: provoked or triggered in advance; made upset or reactive before something happens.
definition.zh: 事先被激怒的；预先被触发反应的（在事情发生前就被挑起情绪或反应）。

examples.en: After reading the comments online, he arrived at the meeting already preprovoked and defensive.
examples.zh: 看完网上的评论后，他到会议时已经是预先被激怒、并且很防御的状态。

examples.en: The coach tried to calm the preprovoked players before the game started.
examples.zh: 教练试图在比赛开始前让那些情绪已被提前挑起的队员冷静下来。

extraExplanation: “preprovoked”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ provoked（“被激怒/被引发”）构成，意思很直观，但在日常英语中比较少见，更常见的表达是：“already upset/angry,” “already triggered,” “primed to react,” “agitated beforehand.”
它常用于描写心理状态或叙事语气：强调一个人还没遇到当下事件，就已经带着被挑起的情绪进入场景。写作中有时用来增加戏剧张力。

summary.en: “Preprovoking” is a rare/nonstandard word meaning “provoking beforehand.”
summary.zh: “preprovoking”是罕见/非标准用法，大意是“提前挑起（情绪/反应）”。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) describing something that provokes or stirs a reaction in advance; “provoking beforehand.”
definition.zh: （罕见／非标准用法）指在事情发生之前就先激起反应或情绪的；“提前挑起/激起”的。

examples.en: The headline felt preprovoking, pushing readers to get angry before they knew the facts.
examples.zh: 这个标题有种“预先挑动情绪”的感觉，让读者在了解事实前就先愤怒起来。

examples.en: Some ads use preprovoking language to create fear and then sell a solution.
examples.zh: 有些广告用“预先煽动”的措辞制造恐惧，再推销解决方案。

definition.en: Present participle of a rare verb sense “to preprovoke”: to provoke in advance; to provoke earlier than expected.
definition.zh: 作为罕见动词用法“preprovoke”的现在分词：提前挑衅/激怒；比预期更早地引发反应。

examples.en: They were preprovoking backlash by teasing the change without explaining it.
examples.zh: 他们在不解释的情况下先放风改动，等于提前引发反弹。

extraExplanation:
“preprovoking”不是常见英语词，通常在正式写作里不推荐使用。更自然的表达有：
- “provoking”/“provocative”（挑衅的、引人反应的）
- “designed to provoke” （旨在挑起反应的）
- “stirring up anger/fear in advance” （提前煽动愤怒/恐惧）
如果你是在某篇文章里看到的，它可能是作者临时造词，用来强调“在事件之前就先挑起情绪/争议”。

summary.en: Preprudent means being careful ahead of time—prudent in advance.
summary.zh: preprudent 指“事先谨慎、提前防范”的态度或做法。

definition.en: Prudent in advance; showing foresight by being careful before a problem happens.
definition.zh: 事先谨慎的；有前瞻性地小心行事（在问题发生前就先做好防范）。

examples.en: It was preprudent to back up the files before updating the computer.
examples.zh: 在更新电脑之前先备份文件是事先谨慎的做法。

examples.en: A preprudent traveler checks the weather and local rules before leaving.
examples.zh: 有前瞻性的旅行者会在出发前查看天气和当地规定。

extraExplanation: “preprudent”非常少见，更多时候英语会用更自然的表达，比如：prudent beforehand / prudent in advance / cautious ahead of time / proactive / preventive。
构词上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ prudent（谨慎的）。在正式写作中用它可能显得生僻，建议根据语境改用常见说法。

summary.en: “Preprudently” isn’t standard English; you probably mean “prudently” (“in a careful, wise way”).
summary.zh: “preprudently” 不是规范英语；你很可能想写的是 “prudently”（“谨慎地、明智地”）。

definition.en: Nonstandard/incorrect spelling; it is not recognized as a standard English word. It is most likely a typo for “prudently” (meaning “in a careful, wise way”).
definition.zh: 非标准/错误拼写；一般不被视为规范英语单词。很可能是把 “prudently”（意为“谨慎地、明智地”）拼错了。

examples.en: If you meant “prudently,” you could write: “She spent her money prudently.”
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“prudently（谨慎地）”，可以写：“She spent her money prudently.”（她花钱很谨慎。）

examples.en: “Preprudently” is likely a typo in this sentence; “prudently” fits the meaning.
examples.zh: 这句话里的 “preprudently” 很可能是拼写错误；用 “prudently” 才符合意思。

extraExplanation: “pre-” 作为前缀通常表示“在……之前”（如 prepay 预付、prewar 战前）。但 “prudently” 本身不常与 “pre-” 组合成新词，所以 “preprudently” 基本可以判断为拼写或自动更正导致的错误。
如果你原本想表达“提前谨慎地做某事”，更自然的说法是：“plan ahead carefully / act cautiously in advance / be prudent in advance”。

summary.en: “Preps” commonly means preparations, can be a verb form of “prep” (prepares), or informally refers to prepositions in grammar.
summary.zh: “preps”常指“准备工作”，也可作动词表示“（他/她）准备”，在语法课堂里还可非正式指“介词”。

definition.en: Preparations; things you do to get ready (short for “preparations” or plural of “prep”).
definition.zh: 准备工作；为某事做的准备（“preparation(s)”的口语缩写，或“prep”的复数）。

examples.en: I still have a few preps to finish before the meeting.
examples.zh: 开会前我还有几项准备工作要完成。

examples.en: The kitchen crew is doing preps for dinner service.
examples.zh: 厨房团队正在为晚餐营业做备料和准备。

definition.en: Third-person singular of “prep”: to prepare something (often food).
definition.zh: “prep”的第三人称单数：准备；（常指）处理食材、备料。

examples.en: He preps vegetables every morning.
examples.zh: 他每天早上都会处理蔬菜、备料。

examples.en: She preps the documents the night before.
examples.zh: 她会在前一晚把文件准备好。

definition.en: Informal plural for “preposition(s)” in grammar class.
definition.zh: （非正式）语法课里指“介词（们）”，即“preposition(s)”。

examples.en: We learned time preps like “at,” “on,” and “in.”
examples.zh: 我们学了表示时间的介词，比如 at、on、in。

examples.en: Can you underline the preps in this sentence?
examples.zh: 你能把这句话里的介词画出来吗？

extraExplanation: “preps”在不同场景里含义差异很大：在职场/生活中多指“准备工作”；在烹饪场景里常指“备料/前置处理”；在英语学习（语法）语境里，老师或同学可能用“preps”简写“prepositions（介词）”。
写作中如果要正式一点，建议用完整形式：preparations 或 prepositions；“preps”更口语、更像课堂或工作现场用语。

summary.en: Prepsychological means “before modern psychology” or “not using psychological explanations.”
summary.zh: Prepsychological 指“现代心理学出现之前的”，或“未采用心理学解释的”。

definition.en: (Academic) Existing before modern psychology developed as a formal science; not yet explained using psychological concepts or methods.
definition.zh: （学术）在现代心理学作为一门正式科学形成之前的；尚未用心理学概念或方法来解释的。

examples.en: Some historians call early theories of the mind prepsychological because they came before experimental psychology.
examples.zh: 一些历史学家把早期的心灵理论称为“prepsychological”，因为它们出现在实验心理学之前。

examples.en: The book offers a prepsychological account of emotions based on moral philosophy rather than mental processes.
examples.zh: 这本书从道德哲学出发而不是从心理过程出发，对情绪给出了一个“prepsychological”的解释。

definition.en: Not focused on psychological motivations or inner mental states; describing behavior in a more surface-level, moral, religious, or social way.
definition.zh: 不以心理动机或内在精神状态为重点的；用较表层的道德、宗教或社会框架来描述行为的。

examples.en: His prepsychological criticism judges characters as simply good or bad, without exploring their trauma or desires.
examples.zh: 他的“prepsychological”式批评只是把人物判为好或坏，并不探讨他们的创伤或欲望。

examples.en: The film feels prepsychological: it shows what people do but rarely why they do it.
examples.zh: 这部电影有种“prepsychological”的感觉：它展示人们做什么，却很少说明他们为什么这么做。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见，多见于学术写作（如哲学史、心理学史、人类学、文学批评）。它常用来强调“还没有引入心理学解释框架”，而不一定是在贬义地说“落后”。
写作中有时会写成带连字符的形式 pre-psychological。两者意思基本相同；是否加连字符常取决于出版社风格。

summary.en: Prepsychology refers to preparatory study for psychology or the period/ideas before psychology became a formal science.
summary.zh: prepsychology 指心理学的预备学习，或指心理学成为正式科学之前的时期/思想。

definition.en: (Academic/curriculum) The stage or courses that come before formal study of psychology; preparatory study for psychology.
definition.zh: （学术/课程）正式学习心理学之前的阶段或课程；为心理学做准备的预备学习。

examples.en: She’s taking prepsychology classes before applying to the psychology major.
examples.zh: 她在申请心理学专业前先修一些心理学预备课程。

examples.en: The program offers prepsychology requirements like statistics and biology.
examples.zh: 这个项目提供心理学预备要求课程，比如统计学和生物学。

definition.en: Existing or happening before psychology became an organized scientific field; “before modern psychology.”
definition.zh: 发生在心理学成为系统科学学科之前的；“现代心理学之前的”。

examples.en: Some philosophers proposed prepsychology ideas about memory and emotion.
examples.zh: 一些哲学家提出了关于记忆与情绪的前心理学时期观点。

examples.en: The book surveys prepsychology theories from ancient Greece.
examples.zh: 这本书概述了古希腊的前心理学理论。

extraExplanation: “prepsychology”不是非常常见的标准词，更常写作“pre-psychology”或直接说“introductory psychology / psychology prerequisites（心理学导论/先修课）”。在学术写作中，表达“现代心理学建立之前的思想”也常用“pre-psychological”或“proto-psychology（心理学雏形）”。

summary.en: Prepsychotic describes the period or signs that may occur before psychosis begins.
summary.zh: Prepsychotic 指可能发生在精神病性症状出现之前的阶段或早期征兆。

definition.en: happening before the onset of psychosis; relating to early warning signs or a stage that may come before a psychotic episode.
definition.zh: 精神病性症状（精神病性发作）出现之前的；与可能在精神病性发作前出现的早期征兆或阶段有关的。

examples.en: The clinician noted prepsychotic symptoms such as unusual suspiciousness and social withdrawal.
examples.zh: 临床医生记录了疑似精神病前期的症状，比如不寻常的多疑和社交退缩。

examples.en: Early support can be helpful when someone shows prepsychotic changes in thinking or behavior.
examples.zh: 当一个人在思维或行为上出现可能的精神病前期变化时，尽早支持可能会有帮助。

extraExplanation: “prepsychotic”多用于医学/心理健康语境，指“精神病性发作（psychosis）之前的阶段或表现”。日常交流中较少使用，更常见的说法是“prodromal（前驱期的）”或“at risk for psychosis（有精神病风险）”。
这个词带有一定标签化风险。谈到具体个人时，更建议用以人为本的表达（如“出现了可能需要评估的早期症状”），避免把人等同于诊断。

summary.en: Prepubertal means “before puberty; not yet in puberty.”
summary.zh: prepubertal 指“青春期前的；尚未进入青春期的”。

definition.en: (Of a person) relating to the time before puberty; not yet having reached puberty.
definition.zh: （指人）青春期前的；尚未进入青春期的。

examples.en: Prepubertal children often grow steadily but have not started the rapid changes of puberty.
examples.zh: 青春期前的孩子通常稳定生长，但还没有开始青春期的快速变化。

examples.en: The doctor said the symptoms began in the prepubertal years.
examples.zh: 医生说这些症状开始于青春期前的几年。

extraExplanation: 这个词在医学、心理学、教育研究中更常见；日常口语里更常用 “before puberty” 或 “not yet in puberty”。
拼写更常见的是 **prepubertal**；你输入的 **prepuberal** 偶尔也见到，但使用频率较低。
由于涉及未成年人发育阶段，英语语境中通常会用较中性、客观的表述，避免带有不必要的评价或暗示。

summary.en: Prepuberally means “before puberty” or “in a prepubertal way,” often used in medical or scientific contexts.
summary.zh: prepuberally 指“青春期开始之前”或“以青春期前的方式”，常见于医学或科学语境。

definition.en: Before puberty; during the time of life when someone has not yet begun puberty.
definition.zh: 在青春期开始之前；处于尚未进入青春期的阶段。

examples.en: The symptoms first appeared prepuberally, around age eight.
examples.zh: 这些症状在青春期前就出现了，大约八岁左右。

examples.en: Some behaviors that look unusual in teens may be normal if they occur prepuberally.
examples.zh: 有些在青少年时期看起来异常的行为，如果发生在青春期前，可能属于正常范围。

definition.en: In a way that is typical of a prepubertal child (in body or development).
definition.zh: 以青春期前儿童典型的方式（在身体或发育方面）。

examples.en: The condition affects growth prepuberally and may change after puberty.
examples.zh: 这种状况会在青春期前影响生长，并可能在青春期后发生变化。

examples.en: Their voice remained prepuberally high.
examples.zh: 他们的嗓音仍保持着青春期前那种偏高的音调。

extraExplanation: “prepuberally”多见于医学、心理学或生物学写作，用来更中性、精确地描述“青春期之前”的时间点或发育状态。日常口语里更常说 “before puberty” 或 “as a child”。
在涉及未成年人身体或性发育的话题时，英语写作通常会使用这种更客观的术语，以保持专业与尊重，避免不必要的联想或不恰当的表达。

summary.en: Prepubertal means “before puberty.”
summary.zh: prepubertal 意为“青春期前的”。

definition.en: Relating to the time before puberty begins (before the body starts developing adult sexual characteristics).
definition.zh: 青春期前的；与青春期开始之前相关的（身体尚未开始出现成人性特征的发展）。

examples.en: The study focused on prepubertal children between ages 6 and 10.
examples.zh: 这项研究关注的是6到10岁的青春期前儿童。

examples.en: Some conditions are easier to treat when identified in the prepubertal years.
examples.zh: 有些疾病在青春期前几年被发现时更容易治疗。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，puberty是“青春期”；prepubertal常见于医学、心理学、教育学语境，用来描述“尚未进入青春期”的阶段。
在日常交流中，直接形容孩子“prepubertal”可能显得过于医学化或敏感；更常见、更中性的说法是“before puberty”或“not yet in puberty”。

summary.en: “Prepubertally” means “before puberty,” mainly in medical/scientific contexts.
summary.zh: “prepubertally”意为“在青春期之前”，主要用于医学或科学语境。

definition.en: Before puberty; in the period of life prior to the onset of puberty (usually used in medical or scientific writing).
definition.zh: 在青春期开始之前；青春期前（常用于医学或科学语境）。

examples.en: The condition often appears prepubertally, usually between ages 6 and 10.
examples.zh: 这种情况常在青春期前出现，通常在6到10岁之间。

examples.en: Researchers compared hormone levels prepubertally and during adolescence.
examples.zh: 研究人员比较了青春期前与青春期期间的激素水平。

examples.en: Some behaviors may look different prepubertally than they do after puberty.
examples.zh: 有些行为在青春期前可能与青春期后表现不同。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，puberty是“青春期”，-ally把形容词变成副词，所以prepubertally常见于临床报告或研究论文中，用来精确说明“发生在青春期之前”。在日常口语中更常说“before puberty”或“as a child”。

summary.en: Prepuberty is the time before puberty starts.
summary.zh: Prepuberty 指青春期开始之前的时期。

definition.en: the period of life before puberty begins; the stage when a child has not yet started the physical changes of puberty
definition.zh: 青春期开始之前的阶段；指孩子尚未出现青春期身体变化的时期

examples.en: In prepuberty, many children grow steadily but have not developed adult body features.
examples.zh: 在青春期前，许多孩子会稳定长高，但还没有出现成人的身体特征。

examples.en: The doctor explained that these changes are uncommon in prepuberty and may need checking.
examples.zh: 医生解释说，这些变化在青春期前并不常见，可能需要检查。

extraExplanation: 构词：pre- 表示“在……之前”，puberty 表示“青春期”，合起来就是“青春期之前”。
使用场景：这个词常见于医学、心理学、教育等较正式的语境；日常口语里也可以说 “before puberty”（青春期之前）。
文化/语用提示：谈论儿童身体发育时，英语中通常会用更中性、尊重隐私的表达方式（如 “developmental changes” 发育变化），在学校或公共场合尤其如此。

summary.en: Prepubescence means the period just before puberty.
summary.zh: prepubescence 指“青春期开始之前的阶段”。

definition.en: The stage of life just before puberty, when a child has not yet begun the physical changes of puberty.
definition.zh: 青春期前期；指在进入青春期之前的阶段，尚未开始青春期的身体变化。

examples.en: The doctor explained that prepubescence is a normal time of steady growth before puberty begins.
examples.zh: 医生解释说，青春期前期是进入青春期之前正常而稳定的生长阶段。

examples.en: Many children in prepubescence are still developing emotionally and socially at their own pace.
examples.zh: 许多处于青春期前期的孩子在情绪和社交方面仍以自己的节奏发展。

extraExplanation: 这个词常见于医学、心理学或教育语境，比日常用语更正式。日常英文里人们更常说“before puberty（青春期之前）”或“preteen（大约10–12岁的孩子）”，但preteen更偏年龄范围，不一定强调生理阶段。
词源上，pre- 表示“在……之前”，pubescence 来自拉丁语 pubescere，意为“开始长出体毛/开始成熟”，所以 prepubescence 字面就是“（性成熟相关变化）开始之前”。

summary.en: Describes someone (usually a child) who has not yet reached puberty.
summary.zh: 指（通常是儿童）尚未进入青春期、处于青春期之前的。

definition.en: Relating to a child who has not yet reached puberty (the physical stage when the body begins to mature sexually).
definition.zh: 与未进入青春期的儿童有关的；青春期前的。

examples.en: The doctor explained that these changes are unusual in a prepubescent child.
examples.zh: 医生解释说，这些变化在青春期前的孩子身上并不常见。

examples.en: The story is told from the perspective of a prepubescent boy.
examples.zh: 这个故事从一个青春期前男孩的视角讲述。

extraExplanation: 这个词较正式，常见于医学、心理学或教育语境；日常口语里更常说“a child who hasn’t hit puberty yet（还没进入青春期的孩子）”。
词形结构：pre-（在……之前）+ pubescent（进入青春期的）。在谈到儿童或身体发育话题时，语气通常应保持客观、尊重，避免带有不必要的评判色彩。

summary.en: Prepubic means “before puberty,” used mainly in medical or scientific contexts.
summary.zh: prepubic 意为“青春期前的”，主要用于医学或科学语境。

definition.en: (Medical) Happening before puberty; relating to the time before the body reaches sexual maturity.
definition.zh: （医学）青春期前的；与青春期到来之前的阶段有关的。

examples.en: The child showed prepubic signs of hormonal imbalance.
examples.zh: 这个孩子出现了青春期前的激素失衡迹象。

examples.en: Doctors monitor growth patterns in prepubic patients who have early health concerns.
examples.zh: 医生会监测有早期健康问题的青春期前患者的生长发育情况。

extraExplanation: “prepubic”在日常英语中很少见，更常见、更标准的说法通常是“prepubertal”（青春期前的）。
词根提示：pre- 表示“在……之前”，pubic 来自 puberty（青春期），与身体进入性成熟相关的变化有关。
这是偏医学/生理语境的词，写作或交流中若不确定，优先用更常见的“prepubertal”。

summary.en: Prepubis is an anatomical term for the forward projection of the pubis in the pelvis, often used in birds and dinosaur anatomy.
summary.zh: Prepubis 是解剖学术语，指骨盆中耻骨向前伸出的突起，常用于鸟类与恐龙的骨盆结构描述。

definition.en: (Anatomy, zoology) A forward-pointing bony projection of the pubis (part of the pelvis), especially discussed in birds and many dinosaur descriptions.
definition.zh: （解剖学／动物学）耻骨（骨盆的一部分）向前伸出的骨质突起；常见于鸟类及许多恐龙骨盆结构的描述中。

examples.en: In some dinosaur pelvis diagrams, the prepubis projects forward from the pubis.
examples.zh: 在一些恐龙骨盆示意图中，prepubis 会从耻骨向前伸出。

examples.en: The paper compares the shape of the prepubis across several species to infer locomotion.
examples.zh: 论文比较了多个物种的 prepubis 形态，以推断其运动方式。

extraExplanation: 这个词多见于古生物学与比较解剖学写作中，日常英语里非常少用。更常见的表达是 **prepubic process**（耻骨前突／耻骨前突起）。
构词上，**pre-** 表示“在……之前／向前”，**pubis** 指“耻骨”。因此它在语义上强调“耻骨的前方（向前）的部分”。

summary.en: Prepublication refers to the period or actions before something is officially published, and it can also describe materials or events that happen before publication.
summary.zh: prepublication 指正式出版前的阶段或活动，也可作形容词表示“出版前的”。

definition.en: The stage or activities that happen before a book, article, or other work is officially published (for example, editing, reviewing, marketing, or early sharing).
definition.zh: （书籍、文章等）正式出版之前的阶段或相关活动（如编辑、审稿、营销或提前分享）。

examples.en: The journal uses strict prepublication review to catch errors before printing.
examples.zh: 这本期刊在印刷前采用严格的出版前审查来发现错误。

examples.en: During the prepublication period, the author worked with editors to revise the manuscript.
examples.zh: 在出版前阶段，作者与编辑合作修改稿件。

definition.en: Happening or done before something is published.
definition.zh: 出版前的；在发表/出版之前进行的。

examples.en: The publisher sent out prepublication copies to reviewers.
examples.zh: 出版社向评论者寄出了出版前样书。

examples.en: They held a prepublication meeting to finalize the cover design.
examples.zh: 他们召开了出版前会议来敲定封面设计。

extraExplanation: 在学术语境中常见相关词：preprint（预印本，未正式发表但已公开的版本）与 peer review（同行评审）。有时“prepublication”也会涉及“embargo（禁发期）”，指媒体在某个时间点前不能公开报道。

summary.en: Prepublish means to publish something ahead of its official release or final version.
summary.zh: prepublish 指在正式发布或最终版本完成前先行发布内容。

definition.en: to publish (something) before its official release date or final version is ready
definition.zh: 在正式发布或最终版本完成前先（预先）发布（某内容）

examples.en: The journal will not allow authors to prepublish the full article online.
examples.zh: 该期刊不允许作者在网上预先发布全文。

examples.en: They prepublished a short excerpt to build interest before the book launch.
examples.zh: 他们在新书发布前预先发布了一小段节选来吸引关注。

extraExplanation: “prepublish”常见于出版与学术语境，尤其指在正式出版前把内容先放到网上（例如公司官网、博客、社交媒体）。在学术圈里，它常与“preprint（预印本）”相关：作者可能在预印本平台发布早期版本，但有些期刊或会议对是否允许这种“预先公开”有规定（例如embargo/禁运期）。

summary.en: Prepuce means the foreskin—the fold of skin covering the glans of the penis (and similarly in some animals).
summary.zh: prepuce 指包皮，即覆盖阴茎龟头的一层皮褶（某些动物也有类似结构）。

definition.en: The fold of skin that covers the head (glans) of the penis; also called the foreskin.
definition.zh: 覆盖阴茎龟头的一层皮褶；也叫包皮。

examples.en: In uncircumcised males, the prepuce can be pulled back to expose the glans.
examples.zh: 在未割包皮的男性中，包皮可以向后翻开以露出龟头。

examples.en: The doctor examined the prepuce for signs of inflammation.
examples.zh: 医生检查包皮是否有发炎迹象。

definition.en: In some animals, a protective fold of skin around a genital organ (often used in biology/veterinary contexts).
definition.zh: （动物）包住生殖器官的保护性皮褶（常用于生物学或兽医学语境）。

examples.en: The veterinarian cleaned the area around the animal’s prepuce.
examples.zh: 兽医清洁了动物包皮周围的区域。

extraExplanation: “prepuce”是医学/生物学用词，日常英语里更常用“foreskin（包皮）”。在谈论健康或就医时，用这些词是中性、客观的。
词源来自拉丁语“praeputium”，意思是“覆盖在前面的东西”。
文学作品中较少出现该词；若出现，通常是医学、解剖学或较为严肃的写作语境。

summary.en: “Prepuces” means the plural of “prepuce,” the foreskin that covers and protects the glans (tip) of the penis (and, less commonly, similar folds in other anatomy).
summary.zh: “prepuces”是“prepuce”的复数，主要指包皮（覆盖并保护龟头的皮肤褶皱；较少也指其他类似的解剖褶皱）。

definition.en: Plural of prepuce: the fold of skin that covers and protects the tip (glans) of the penis; also called the foreskin.
definition.zh: prepuce 的复数：覆盖并保护阴茎龟头的皮肤褶皱；也称包皮。

examples.en: In male anatomy, prepuces help protect the glans when the penis is not erect.
examples.zh: 在男性解剖学中，包皮在阴茎未勃起时有助于保护龟头。

examples.en: The doctor examined the prepuces for signs of irritation or infection.
examples.zh: 医生检查包皮是否有刺激或感染的迹象。

definition.en: In biology (less common), folds of skin around certain organs in some animals (for example, covering the clitoris).
definition.zh: （较少见，生物学）某些动物围绕特定器官的皮肤褶皱（例如覆盖阴蒂的褶皱）。

examples.en: Some textbooks describe female prepuces as folds of tissue that cover the clitoris.
examples.zh: 一些教材把女性包皮描述为覆盖阴蒂的组织褶皱。

extraExplanation: “prepuce”是较正式的医学用语；日常英语更常说“foreskin”。
在医学语境里常见相关词：uncircumcised（未割包皮的）、circumcision（包皮环切/割包皮）、phimosis（包茎）、paraphimosis（嵌顿包茎）。这些词通常出现在医生沟通或健康科普中。
如果你是在阅读医学文章或教材，注意它通常指解剖结构本身，不带评价或粗俗色彩；在日常对话中使用时，语境要得体。

summary.en: Prepueblo means “pre-Pueblo”: the period/cultures in the U.S. Southwest before later Pueblo-era villages, and it can also name that period.
summary.zh: prepueblo意为“普韦布洛前期”：指美国西南部普韦布洛时期村落出现之前的年代与文化，也可指该时期本身。

definition.en: (Archaeology, especially in the U.S. Southwest) relating to the period and cultures that came before the Pueblo peoples’ later, well-known Pueblo-era villages (often associated with early “Basketmaker” traditions).
definition.zh: （考古，尤指美国西南部）指普韦布洛（Pueblo）时期之前的年代与文化，常与早期“篮匠人（Basketmaker）”传统相关。

examples.en: The museum has a small collection of prepueblo pottery fragments.
examples.zh: 那家博物馆收藏了一小批普韦布洛前期的陶片。

examples.en: Archaeologists found a prepueblo pit house beneath the later Pueblo structure.
examples.zh: 考古学家在较晚的普韦布洛建筑下方发现了一座普韦布洛前期的地穴式房屋。

definition.en: The pre-Pueblo period itself (used as a noun in some archaeological writing).
definition.zh: 普韦布洛前期（在部分考古文献中可作名词使用）。

examples.en: The report focuses on the prepueblo and early Pueblo transitions.
examples.zh: 这份报告重点讨论普韦布洛前期到早期普韦布洛阶段的过渡。

extraExplanation: “prepueblo”常见于学术或博物馆语境，并不属于日常英语词汇；更常见的写法是“pre-Pueblo”（带连字符且P大写），表示与“Pueblo（普韦布洛人/普韦布洛文化）”相关的历史分期。
在美国西南部考古中，这一时期常与“Basketmaker（篮匠人）”阶段联系，用来指向后来出现大型石/土坯村落（pueblos）之前的生活方式与居住形态（如pit house 地穴式住宅）。
使用时注意尊重文化称谓：当指当代或历史上的族群与文化传统时，通常将“Pueblo”视为专名并大写。

summary.en: “Prepunch” means to make holes or perforations in something ahead of time, or the pre-made hole/perforation itself.
summary.zh: “prepunch”指在使用前预先打孔/穿孔，也可指预先打好的孔或穿孔。

definition.en: to punch holes, slots, or perforations in something in advance (before it is used, assembled, or processed)
definition.zh: 预先打孔；预冲孔（在使用、组装或后续加工前先打出孔、槽或穿孔）

examples.en: The factory prepunches the panels so workers can bolt them together faster.
examples.zh: 工厂会先把面板预先打孔，这样工人能更快用螺栓组装。

examples.en: We need to prepunch the tickets so they tear off cleanly at the gate.
examples.zh: 我们需要把票预先打穿孔，这样在入口处就能干净地撕下。

definition.en: a hole, slot, or perforation that has been made in advance
definition.zh: 预先打好的孔；预冲孔；预穿孔

examples.en: Check that each prepunch lines up with the screws.
examples.zh: 检查每个预冲孔是否与螺丝对齐。

extraExplanation: “prepunch”多见于制造业、建筑装配、包装、票券/表格印刷等语境，强调“为了后续更省力或更准确而提前打孔/穿孔”。
在日常口语中不算常用，更常见的说法是 “pre-punch” 或 “punch holes in advance”。

summary.en: Prepunched means holes were made ahead of time, so something is ready to use or assemble.
summary.zh: prepunched 指“事先已经打好孔”，便于直接使用或安装。

definition.en: having holes or perforations made in advance (before use or assembly)
definition.zh: 预先打孔的；预制孔的（在使用或安装前就把孔打好）

examples.en: Use the prepunched holes to mount the shelf to the wall.
examples.zh: 用预先打好的孔把架子固定到墙上。

examples.en: The forms come prepunched, so they fit easily into a binder.
examples.zh: 这些表格是预先打孔的，所以很容易装进活页夹。

examples.en: The ticket was prepunched to show it had already been used.
examples.zh: 票上预先打了孔，用来表示它已被使用过。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“预先”，和“punched（打孔的）”结合，常见于制造、包装、办公用品等语境：prepunched paper（预打孔纸）、prepunched panels/boards（预打孔板材）。
有时也会看到“pre-punched”带连字符，尤其在名词前作定语时更常见；两种写法通常都能理解。

summary.en: “Prepunches” means pre-punches holes in advance, or the pre-punched holes themselves.
summary.zh: “prepunches”指“预先打孔”（动词），或指“预先打好的孔”（名词，常用复数）。

definition.en: (verb) To punch holes in something in advance (before assembly, binding, filing, or installation).
definition.zh: （动词）预先在某物上打孔（在装订、归档、安装等之前先打好孔）。

examples.en: The printer prepunches the paper so it can go straight into a binder.
examples.zh: 打印机会先把纸预先打孔，这样就能直接放进活页夹。

examples.en: We prepunched the metal sheets to speed up the installation.
examples.zh: 我们先给金属板预先打孔，以加快安装速度。

definition.en: (noun, usually plural) Holes that have been punched in advance; pre-punched holes.
definition.zh: （名词，常用复数）预先打好的孔；预冲孔。

examples.en: Line up the prepunches with the posts of the binder.
examples.zh: 把预先打好的孔对齐活页夹的夹柱。

examples.en: The prepunches didn’t match our folder, so we had to re-punch the pages.
examples.zh: 预先打好的孔和我们的文件夹不匹配，所以我们得重新打孔。

extraExplanation: “prepunch”常见于办公用品、印刷装订、制造业（钣金/面板加工）等语境，表示“提前打孔以便后续流程更快、更标准化”。
拼写上也可能写作“pre-punch”。“prepunches”既可能是动词第三人称单数（He prepunches…），也可能是名词复数（the prepunches are misaligned）。

summary.en: Prepunching means making holes in something in advance, or something that already has holes made.
summary.zh: prepunching 指预先打孔/预冲孔；也可指已经预先打孔的材料。

definition.en: (of paper, cards, tickets, metal sheets, etc.) having holes or perforations made in advance, usually so it can be torn out, filed, or assembled easily
definition.zh: （纸张、卡片、票据、金属片等）预先打孔的；预先冲孔/打孔处理过的（便于撕下、装订或组装）

examples.en: The forms come in prepunching paper, so you can put them straight into a binder.
examples.zh: 这些表格用的是预先打孔的纸张，所以可以直接放进活页夹。

examples.en: We switched to prepunching tickets to speed up entry at the gate.
examples.zh: 我们改用预先打孔的票，以加快入口检票速度。

definition.en: the act or process of punching holes in something before the next step (such as binding, printing, or assembly)
definition.zh: 预打孔；预冲孔（在装订、印刷或装配等下一步之前先打孔的过程）

examples.en: Prepunching saves time during final assembly.
examples.zh: 预打孔能在最终装配时节省时间。

examples.en: They added a prepunching step before binding the manuals.
examples.zh: 他们在装订说明书前增加了预打孔步骤。

definition.en: punching holes in something in advance (used as a present participle/gerund)
definition.zh: 预先打孔；正在进行预打孔（动名词/现在分词用法）

examples.en: We’re prepunching the pages today and binding them tomorrow.
examples.zh: 我们今天给页面预先打孔，明天再装订。

extraExplanation: “prepunching”通常写作“pre-punching”或更常见的过去分词形容词“prepunched”（如：prepunched holes / prepunched paper）。在工业制造中也常指“预冲孔”，用于金属板材或零件，方便后续对位、装配或减少加工工序。

summary.en: “Prepunctual” is a rare, informal word meaning “early—arriving before the agreed time.”
summary.zh: “prepunctual”是一个罕见的非正式用词，意思是“提前到、比约定时间更早到达”。

definition.en: (Rare, informal) Arriving before the agreed time; earlier than punctual.
definition.zh: （罕见、非正式）比“准时”更早；提前到达的。

examples.en: She’s so prepunctual that she shows up ten minutes early for everything.
examples.zh: 她特别“prepunctual”，什么事都提前十分钟到。

examples.en: If you’re prepunctual for the interview, you’ll have time to calm down.
examples.zh: 如果你面试提前到，你就有时间放松一下。

definition.en: (Very rare) Happening before the time a signal, mark, or punctuation would normally appear (used in specialized writing contexts).
definition.zh: （极罕见）在通常应出现的信号、标记或标点之前发生的（多见于非常专业的语境）。

examples.en: The editor noted a prepunctual pause in the transcript.
examples.zh: 编辑在记录稿里标出了一个“标点之前的停顿”。

extraExplanation: “prepunctual”不是现代英语里的常用词，很多词典里也找不到。日常表达“提前到/比约定时间更早”，更自然的说法是：early, ahead of time, arrive early, be early, prompt（更偏“迅速、及时”）。
词形上 pre- 表示“在……之前”，punctual 表示“准时的”。因此即使读者没见过这个词，也通常能猜到它想表达“比准时还早”。但正式写作中不建议使用，以免显得不地道或引起误解。

summary.en: Prepunish means to punish someone in advance, before an expected wrongdoing.
summary.zh: prepunish 指在预期的过错发生之前就先行惩罚。

definition.en: to punish someone in advance (before an expected or possible wrongdoing), often to prevent future misbehavior
definition.zh: 预先惩罚；先发制人地惩罚（在可能的过错发生之前就处罚，常为防止再犯）

examples.en: The coach refused to prepunish the team for mistakes that hadn’t happened yet.
examples.zh: 教练拒绝因为还没发生的失误就预先惩罚全队。

examples.en: Some critics argue that harsh “zero-tolerance” policies can feel like they prepunish students.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为，严苛的“零容忍”政策会让人感觉是在预先惩罚学生。

extraExplanation: “prepunish”在现代英语中比较少见，更多时候人们会说“punish preemptively / punish in advance”。写作中也常见带连字符的形式“pre-punish”。
这个词常用于讨论制度或政策（如学校纪律、治安、司法）是否在“未发生具体行为前”就施加惩罚，因此语气可能带批评或伦理争议。

summary.en: “Prepunishment” means punishing someone before they actually commit a wrongdoing, usually based on prediction.
summary.zh: “prepunishment”指在过错尚未发生前就先行惩罚，通常基于预测。

definition.en: Punishment given in advance, before a crime or wrongdoing is actually committed (based on prediction or suspicion).
definition.zh: 在实际犯罪或过错发生之前就施加的惩罚（基于预测或怀疑）。

examples.en: The novel criticizes a society that uses prepunishment to control its citizens.
examples.zh: 这部小说批判了一个用“预先惩罚”来控制公民的社会。

examples.en: Some people argue that prepunishment violates basic legal principles like due process.
examples.zh: 有人认为预先惩罚违背了正当程序等基本法律原则。

extraExplanation: 这个词不算常见，更常见的相关词是“preemptive punishment”（先发制人的惩罚）或科幻语境里的“precrime”（预犯罪）。
构词很直观：pre-（在……之前）+ punishment（惩罚）。它常出现在伦理学、法学讨论或反乌托邦/科幻作品里，用来讨论“预测犯罪是否能成为惩罚依据”。
文化联想：电影/故事《Minority Report（少数派报告）》常被用来讨论类似概念（预测犯罪与提前处罚的道德与法律问题）。

summary.en: Prepupa is the insect stage right before the pupa, when the larva stops feeding and prepares to pupate.
summary.zh: Prepupa 指昆虫化蛹前的阶段：幼虫停止取食并为变成蛹做准备。

definition.en: (In insects) a developmental stage just before the pupa, when the larva stops feeding and prepares to pupate (often becoming less active and starting to form a cocoon or pupal case).
definition.zh: （昆虫）蛹前期：幼虫进入“蛹”之前的发育阶段。此时通常停止取食、活动减少，并开始为化蛹做准备（如结茧或形成蛹壳）。

examples.en: The caterpillar entered the prepupa stage and stopped eating.
examples.zh: 这只毛毛虫进入了蛹前期，开始停止进食。

examples.en: In many moths, the prepupa spins a cocoon before becoming a pupa.
examples.zh: 许多蛾类在蛹前期会先结茧，然后才变成蛹。

extraExplanation: “prepupa”常用于昆虫完全变态（卵→幼虫→蛹→成虫）的描述，尤其见于鳞翅目（蝶、蛾）和膜翅目（蜂、蚂蚁）。它不是所有昆虫都严格使用的阶段名称，更多是科研或养殖观察中为了更精细区分发育阶段而使用。
相关词：larva（幼虫）、pupa（蛹）、pupate（化蛹）、metamorphosis（变态）、cocoon（茧）。

summary.en: Prepupal means “before the pupal stage,” used mainly in biology to describe insects just before they become pupae.
summary.zh: prepupal 意为“蛹期之前的”，主要用于生物学中，指昆虫在化蛹前的阶段或状态。

definition.en: (Biology) Happening before the pupal stage of an insect; describing a stage or condition right before an insect becomes a pupa.
definition.zh: （生物）蛹期之前的；指昆虫在化蛹前的阶段或状态。

examples.en: During the prepupal stage, the larva stops eating and begins to prepare for pupation.
examples.zh: 在蛹前期，幼虫会停止进食，并开始为化蛹做准备。

examples.en: The researcher measured hormone levels in prepupal insects to understand metamorphosis.
examples.zh: 研究人员测量蛹前期昆虫的激素水平，以了解变态发育。

extraExplanation: “prepupal”常用于昆虫学与发育生物学，尤其在描述完全变态昆虫（如蝴蝶、甲虫、苍蝇）时：卵（egg）→幼虫（larva）→蛹前期（prepupa / prepupal stage）→蛹（pupa）→成虫（adult）。
它常与名词连用：prepupal stage（蛹前期）、prepupal larva（蛹前幼虫）。不同物种的“蛹前期”外观与持续时间差异较大，但常见特征是停止摄食、寻找地点、身体收缩或改变，准备形成蛹。

summary.en: “Prepurchase” means to buy something ahead of time, often before release (like a preorder).
summary.zh: “prepurchase”指在提前购买，常用于产品未发售前的预购场景。

definition.en: to buy something before it is officially available or before you need it (often online, sometimes as a pre-order)
definition.zh: 在正式发售之前或在你需要之前先购买（常见于线上预购/提前购买）

examples.en: I prepurchased the game to get the bonus content.
examples.zh: 我提前购买了这款游戏，以获得额外奖励内容。

examples.en: Many fans prepurchase concert tickets as soon as they go on sale.
examples.zh: 很多粉丝一开售就会提前购买演唱会门票。

definition.en: an early purchase made in advance of release or need
definition.zh: 提前购买；预先购入的商品/行为

examples.en: The company offered a discount for every prepurchase.
examples.zh: 公司对每一笔提前购买都提供折扣。

extraExplanation: “prepurchase”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ purchase（“购买”）构成。日常更常见的说法是 “preorder”（预购）或 “buy in advance”（提前买）。在电商语境里，prepurchase 往往暗示“提前付款/锁定资格”，有时还会附带“预购奖励”。

summary.en: “Prepurchased” means bought ahead of time; it’s also the past form of “prepurchase.”
summary.zh: “prepurchased”表示“预先购买的”，也可作动词“prepurchase”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (Of something) bought in advance, before it is needed or used.
definition.zh: （某物）预先购买的；提前买好的。

examples.en: We used our prepurchased tickets to enter the museum quickly.
examples.zh: 我们用预先买好的门票快速进入了博物馆。

examples.en: The plan includes a set of prepurchased data each month.
examples.zh: 该套餐每月包含一部分预先购买的数据流量。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “prepurchase”: to buy something ahead of time.
definition.zh: “prepurchase”的过去式/过去分词：预先购买；提前购买。

examples.en: She prepurchased her train pass online to save money.
examples.zh: 她在网上提前买了火车通票来省钱。

examples.en: All seats were prepurchased, so there were no tickets at the door.
examples.zh: 所有座位都已提前购票，因此现场不售票。

extraExplanation: “prepurchased”在实际写作中也常写作“pre-purchased”（带连字符），尤其在正式或编辑更严格的文本里更常见；两者意思相同。
常见搭配：prepurchased tickets（预购门票）、prepurchased credits（预购额度/点数）、prepurchased plan/package（预购套餐）。
与“preordered”区别：preorder强调“先下单/预订”，可能还没付款或未发货；prepurchase更强调“已提前买下/已付款”。

summary.en: A prepurchaser is someone who buys something ahead of time, often in formal or business contexts.
summary.zh: prepurchaser 指“提前购买者/预先购买者”，多用于正式或商业语境。

definition.en: A person or organization that buys something in advance, or before a main sale/event (often used in business, contracts, or ticketing).
definition.zh: 预先购买者；提前购买某物的人或机构（常用于商业、合同或票务语境）。

examples.en: All prepurchasers will receive a confirmation email before shipping begins.
examples.zh: 所有预先购买者将在发货开始前收到一封确认邮件。

examples.en: The company offered a discount to prepurchasers of the new software.
examples.zh: 公司为提前购买新软件的用户提供了折扣。

extraExplanation: “prepurchaser”由前缀 pre-（在……之前）+ purchaser（购买者）构成，常见于较正式或法律/商业文件中；日常英语里更常说 “pre-order customer/buyer”（预购客户/买家）或直接用 “preorder” 作动词（如：I preordered it）。
相关词：prepurchase（vt. 预先购买），preorder（v./n. 预购/预订），advance purchase（提前购买，常见于机票/车票）。

summary.en: “Prepurchases” means purchases made in advance, or the act of buying something ahead of time.
summary.zh: “prepurchases”指提前购买（预购），也可指提前购买的那些订单/购买行为。

definition.en: (plural noun) Purchases made in advance (before a product is used, released, or needed).
definition.zh: （复数名词）预先购买的商品/服务；提前完成的购买。

examples.en: Ticket prepurchases help the event organizers plan seating and staffing.
examples.zh: 提前购票能帮助活动主办方规划座位和工作人员安排。

examples.en: The company saw strong prepurchases of the new game before launch day.
examples.zh: 这家公司在新游戏发售前看到了大量的预购。

definition.en: (verb) To buy something in advance; to purchase ahead of time.
definition.zh: （动词）预先购买；提前采购。

examples.en: Some fans prepurchase the collector’s edition months early.
examples.zh: 一些粉丝会提前几个月预购典藏版。

examples.en: We prepurchased enough supplies for the whole semester.
examples.zh: 我们提前采购了足够整个学期的物资。

extraExplanation: “prepurchases”常见于商业、票务、软件/游戏等场景，强调“在正式需要之前先买好”。口语里更常用的说法是“preorders（预购）/ advance purchases（提前购买）”。
作为动词时，“prepurchase”相对少见，写作中有时会用更自然的“purchase in advance”。

summary.en: Prepurchasing means buying something ahead of time, often to save money or ensure supply.
summary.zh: prepurchasing 指提前购买/预先采购，常为省钱或确保供货。

definition.en: the act or practice of buying something in advance (before you will actually need it)
definition.zh: 预先购买；提前采购（在真正需要之前先买）

examples.en: Bulk prepurchasing can lower costs for a small business.
examples.zh: 大量预先采购可以降低小企业的成本。

examples.en: The school is considering prepurchasing laptops for next year’s students.
examples.zh: 学校正在考虑为明年的学生提前购买笔记本电脑。

definition.en: describing something done before a later need or event (used as an adjective, especially in business)
definition.zh: 预购的；事先采购的（常用于商业语境作形容词）

examples.en: There is a prepurchasing agreement for office supplies.
examples.zh: 有一份办公用品的预购协议。

examples.en: Prepurchasing decisions depend on storage space and demand.
examples.zh: 预购决策取决于储存空间和需求。

definition.en: present participle of “prepurchase”: buying something in advance
definition.zh: “prepurchase”的现在分词：预先购买

examples.en: They are prepurchasing tickets to avoid price increases.
examples.zh: 他们正在提前买票以避免涨价。

extraExplanation: “prepurchasing”常见于供应链/采购（procurement）语境，强调“提前锁价、确保供货”，但也可能带来库存（inventory）积压、过期或现金流压力。
相关常见搭配：prepurchasing strategy（预购策略）, prepurchasing agreement/contract（预购协议/合同）, bulk prepurchasing（批量预购）。

summary.en: A rare, nonstandard verb meaning “to assign or plan a purpose in advance.”
summary.zh: 一个罕见、非标准的动词，意思是“预先指定或规划用途”。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) to decide the purpose of something in advance; to plan or assign a purpose beforehand.
definition.zh: （罕见/非标准用法）提前决定某物的用途；预先规划或指定用途。

examples.en: Before buying equipment, we prepurposed it for training rather than research.
examples.zh: 在购买设备之前，我们先把它预先规划为培训用途，而不是研究用途。

examples.en: The team tried to prepurpose the budget so there would be less confusion later.
examples.zh: 团队试图先把预算的用途规划好，这样之后就不容易混乱。

extraExplanation: “prepurpose”在现代英语里非常少见，很多母语者会觉得不自然，甚至认为是拼写/造词。写作中更常用：preplan（预先计划）、designate in advance（提前指定）、plan ahead（提前规划）、set aside for…（预留作……用）。
如果你想表达“这个物品本来就被设计来做某事”，也可以用：be intended for… / be meant for… / be designed for… 这些更地道。

summary.en: “Prepurposed” (rare) means already planned or designated in advance for a particular purpose.
summary.zh: “prepurposed”（较罕见）指某物事先就被规划/指定为某种用途。

definition.en: (Rare; often nonstandard) Already assigned a purpose or use in advance; planned or set aside beforehand for a specific purpose.
definition.zh: （罕见；常被视为非标准用法）预先被指定用途；事先规划好要用来做某事的。

examples.en: The rooms were prepurposed for storage, so we couldn’t use them as offices.
examples.zh: 这些房间事先就被规划为储物间，所以我们不能把它们当办公室用。

examples.en: In her outline, each paragraph was prepurposed to support one key point.
examples.zh: 在她的提纲里，每一段都预先设定用来支撑一个关键论点。

definition.en: (Rare) To assign a purpose to something ahead of time; to plan something for a specific use in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见）预先给某物定用途；事先规划某事用于特定目的。

examples.en: They prepurposed the grant money for teacher training.
examples.zh: 他们把这笔拨款预先规划用于教师培训。

examples.en: We prepurposed the extra budget for emergencies.
examples.zh: 我们把额外预算预先设定为应急之用。

extraExplanation:
“prepurposed”在英语里不算常见词，很多情况下会被认为是临时造词（coinage）。更自然、更常用的表达通常是：
- already designated / set aside / intended for…（已经被指定/预留/打算用于……）
- preassigned（预先分配的）
如果你的意思是“把旧东西改作他用”，常用词是“repurposed”（改作他用的），而不是“prepurposed”。

summary.en: Prepurposing is an uncommon term meaning deciding or designing something’s purpose in advance.
summary.zh: Prepurposing（不常用）指在事物实际使用前就预先决定或按用途进行设计。

definition.en: (Uncommon) The act of assigning or designing a purpose for something in advance, before it is actually used or built.
definition.zh: （不常用）在某物真正被使用或建成之前，预先为它指定用途或按某个用途去设计。

examples.en: In the planning stage, the team discussed the prepurposing of the space for future community events.
examples.zh: 在规划阶段，团队讨论了把这个空间预先设定为未来社区活动用途。

examples.en: Good prepurposing can reduce waste by making sure materials fit a clear goal from the start.
examples.zh: 良好的预先设定用途能减少浪费，因为从一开始就让材料匹配明确目标。

definition.en: (Uncommon, gerund) The process of giving something a purpose ahead of time.
definition.zh: （不常用，动名词）提前赋予某物用途的过程。

examples.en: They are prepurposing the new software to support both teaching and research.
examples.zh: 他们正在提前把这套新软件规划为同时支持教学和科研。

examples.en: Prepurposing resources helps the project stay focused.
examples.zh: 提前规划资源用途有助于项目保持聚焦。

extraExplanation: “prepurposing”在英语里并不常见，更常见、也更自然的说法是“repurposing”（把旧东西改作他用/再利用）或“preplanning / planning ahead”（提前规划）。
如果你想表达“在设计阶段就决定用途”，更地道的表达包括：“design with a purpose in mind”“plan for future use”“build in flexibility”。

summary.en: Prepurposive means happening before a clear purpose or intention is formed—early, exploratory, and not yet deliberate.
summary.zh: Prepurposive 指在明确目的或意图形成之前的状态——早期的、探索性的、尚非刻意的。

definition.en: existing or happening before a clear purpose, plan, or goal is formed; not yet purposeful or intentional
definition.zh: 在明确目的、计划或目标形成之前存在或发生的；尚未具有目的性、尚非刻意的

examples.en: The baby’s early movements are often described as prepurposive rather than deliberate actions.
examples.zh: 婴儿早期的动作常被描述为“前目的性”的，而不是有意的行为。

examples.en: Her sketches were prepurposive—she was exploring ideas before deciding what to paint.
examples.zh: 她的素描是前目的性的——她在决定画什么之前先探索想法。

extraExplanation: “prepurposive”不是日常常用词，更常见于心理学、发展研究或写作评论中，用来强调“尚未形成明确意图/目标”的阶段。
构词上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ purposive（有目的的）。在一般写作里，也可以用更常见的表达替换：aimless（无明确目标的）、unplanned（未计划的）、not yet intentional（尚非有意的）。

summary.en: A medical adjective meaning “related to the prepuce (foreskin or clitoral hood).”
summary.zh: 医学形容词，表示“与包皮（阴茎包皮或阴蒂包皮/阴蒂罩）有关的”。

definition.en: Relating to the prepuce (the fold of skin covering the head of the penis, or the clitoral hood).
definition.zh: 与包皮有关的；与阴蒂包皮（阴蒂包皮/阴蒂罩）有关的。

examples.en: The doctor noted mild preputial swelling during the exam.
examples.zh: 医生在检查时注意到轻微的包皮肿胀。

examples.en: Good hygiene can help prevent preputial irritation.
examples.zh: 良好的清洁习惯有助于预防包皮刺激。

extraExplanation: 该词属于医学/解剖学用语，常见于病历记录或医学科普中。日常英语里更常用“foreskin (包皮)”或“clitoral hood (阴蒂包皮/阴蒂罩)”来表达。
词源来自拉丁语 *praeputium*（包皮）+ 形容词后缀 *-al*（“……的”）。
语体提示：因为涉及私密部位，在公共或不熟悉的场合交流时可用更委婉或更通俗的说法，并注意尊重对方感受与文化差异。

summary.en: Preputium is a medical/anatomical term for the foreskin (prepuce), and sometimes for similar protective folds like the clitoral hood.
summary.zh: preputium 是医学/解剖学用语，主要指阴茎包皮（prepuce/foreskin），有时也泛指类似的保护性皮肤褶皱（如阴蒂包皮）。

definition.en: (Anatomy, medical) The fold of skin that covers and protects the tip (glans) of the penis; the foreskin (also called the prepuce).
definition.zh: （解剖/医学）覆盖并保护阴茎龟头的皮肤褶皱；包皮（亦称 prepuce）。

examples.en: In medical texts, preputium is another term for the foreskin.
examples.zh: 在医学文献中，preputium 是“包皮”的另一种说法。

examples.en: Inflammation can occur in the preputium if the area is irritated or infected.
examples.zh: 如果该部位受到刺激或感染，包皮可能会发生炎症。

definition.en: More broadly, a similar protective fold of skin in female anatomy, such as the clitoral hood (a type of prepuce).
definition.zh: 更广义地指女性解剖中类似的保护性皮肤褶皱，如阴蒂包皮（阴蒂包皮/包皮的一种）。

examples.en: Some anatomy resources use preputium to describe the clitoral hood as well.
examples.zh: 一些解剖学资料也用 preputium 来指“阴蒂包皮”。

extraExplanation: 这是一个偏学术/医学的拉丁来源词，在日常英语里更常说 foreskin（包皮）或 prepuce（包皮，医学用）。
复数常见形式是 preputia。
涉及身体与性器官的词汇在不同文化语境中敏感度不同：在医学讨论中它是中性术语，但在非医学场合使用可能显得过于专业或突兀。

summary.en: Prepyloric means ‘just before the pylorus’ in the stomach.
summary.zh: prepyloric 指“胃幽门之前（幽门前区）的”。

definition.en: (Anatomy/medicine) Located just before the pylorus (the opening from the stomach into the small intestine), or relating to that area of the stomach.
definition.zh: （解剖/医学）位于幽门之前的；与胃的幽门前区有关的。

examples.en: The scan showed thickening in the prepyloric region of the stomach.
examples.zh: 扫描显示胃幽门前区增厚。

examples.en: The doctor found a small prepyloric ulcer during the endoscopy.
examples.zh: 医生在胃镜检查中发现一个小的幽门前溃疡。

synonyms: antral (often related, but not always identical)
extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，pylorus（幽门）是胃通向十二指肠的出口处；因此 prepyloric 常见于医学影像、胃镜报告或病理描述中，用来精确说明病变位置（例如“prepyloric ulcer / 幽门前溃疡”）。

summary.en: A technical adjective meaning “in front of a pyramidal structure,” especially in anatomy.
summary.zh: 医学/解剖学术语，指“位于锥体状结构前方的”，尤指延髓锥体前方。

definition.en: Located in front of (or occurring before) a pyramid-shaped structure, especially the pyramids of the medulla in neuroanatomy.
definition.zh: 位于某个“锥体状结构”之前的；（尤指神经解剖中）位于延髓锥体前方的。

examples.en: In some anatomy texts, a “prepyramidal” region refers to an area anterior to the medullary pyramids.
examples.zh: 在一些解剖学教材中，“prepyramidal（锥体前的）区域”指的是位于延髓锥体前方的区域。

examples.en: The surgeon reviewed the prepyramidal landmarks before beginning the procedure.
examples.zh: 外科医生在开始手术前复习了锥体前的解剖标志。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是常见前缀，表示“在……之前/前方”；“pyramidal”意为“锥体的/锥体状的”。合在一起多用于医学与解剖学写作，日常英语中很少见。
在神经解剖语境里，“pyramids（锥体）”通常指延髓腹侧的锥体结构，与皮质脊髓束等通路相关；因此“prepyramidal”常用来描述其前方的区域或结构。
